It would be beneficial to have an editing finction within the issues tab in navisworks to delete and retake the issue thumbnail. There is a really convoluted way to change the issue thumbnail within ACC but that is not benefitial for users who primarily use na

title: Issues Visible in 'Save to Docs' Files
body_text: Under Model Coordination when using the 'Save to Docs' feature it would be nice if the file would contain Issues that were visible when viewing from Docs. Right now, there is no way that I know of for someone to view the clash (Issue) in context without a license to Model Coordination.

title: Enhance Markup Control for Printing and Form/Issue Report Exports - ACC
body_text: I'd like to propose two important enhancements to the markup behavior in ACC that would significantly improve user experience and workflow efficiency: Direct Option to Print With or Without Markups: Currently, when printing a file that contains markups directly from ACC, there isn't a straightforward option to choose whether these markups should be included in the printout. The current process can feel counter-intuitive. Suggestion: Please add a simple toggle or checkbox (e.g., "Include Markups"

title: Build - Submittals - include all revisions into pdf export
body_text: Can you please include all revisions into PDF export? Now only latest revision is included into pdf. Information from previous revisions is important to us, mostly comments and reasons for rejections.

title: Script to copy parameter from one attribute to another one
body_text: DOCS/ FOLDERS / DOCUMENTS We have customised attribute called `Title` which is part of our Naming Standard. There are over 70 projects using this attribute already therefor we are after script which would copy parameter from customised attribute "Title" into build-in attribute "Description". We were never told Description is a Title hence we created customised attribute for Title. Now we can not see Titles when we create Transmittals as there is Description attribute showing in a body of Transmi

title: Photo image quality
body_text: Please allow option to change default quality for photos. Difficult to see details in photos based on default setting.

title: Document Templates and Variables in REPORTs, FORMS and TAKEOFF
body_text: Using variables in document templates in COST is amazing! This request is for the ability to have this same feature in BUILD-Forms, Reports and Takeoff. This way we can use ACC interface, but still output to client specified forms.

title: eTransmit on ACC
body_text: It would be really cool if eTransmit worked exactly the same on ACC as it does when not on ACC. That's all. It is very common to need to send a Revit Model with all the linked CAD/images and an option to purge content including views and sheets. You know, just like eTransmit but on ACC.

title: Review file attributes MISSING
body_text: Under Reviews, you can see the files with minimal information. To see all the attributes of the files, you have to open another tab. This complicates the process for the reviewers, The request is to see all selectable attributes when selecting the gearbox settings.

title: "Get Link" option in file menu
body_text: Generating link to a file is crucial to communication and ease to share information on any project. It's very convenient to send someone link e.g. via MS Teams, because alternatively we need to manually navigate another user through folders to get to the file. Here are 2 things that could enhance this process: Adding "Get Link" option in file menu Now share link option is "hidden" in share menu and also by default share option is set to send mail with links. It could mislead that it's the only o

title: Empty packages in project template
body_text: Our clients use packages to signify the completion of a building phase. It would be highly beneficial to have the ability to set up empty packages within the project template. This feature would allow, for example, empty packages to be preconfigured for the completion of each phase: Sketch design Preliminary design Definitive design Environmental permit Technical design Execution design

title: Saved views in compare tool
body_text: It would be REALLY beneficial to be able to save views in the compare tool on ACC. Instead of taking snips and saving them down, it would be beneficial to have the ability to save views and even use those views for reference when creating issues. For example, while reviewing design models, I need to compare the latest version to the previous version. It's a rather large model and I create snips to drop into a PDF. It would be nice to have the ability to use those views to create a log and tracka

title: Improve "Issues" ability to filter/find "@" mentions in comments
body_text: The ability to add comments to a specific issue to have a discussion about a particular issue is very helpful, but it is very difficult to find ongoing issues that you have been involved in. At minimum, it would be nice if the main "Issues" page had the ability to add a column or ability to search for issues that have specific people mentioned in the comments. It would be even better if there was some way to have a more expanded dashboard of issues that could keep people up to date with the most

title: Allow user to update existing projects with new template settings
body_text: Things are constantly being added to Docs, and while that's great, it means that some functionality we have set using the template in new projects, we have to set in existing projects for each and every one. If we could apply template settings to existing projects, it would take away a massive amount of configuration changes we are currently having to make, just because a project pre-dates functionality added to Docs which can be set by our template. For example, Naming Standards are a new featu

title: Allow user setting the height/view height in first person view of web 3D viewer.
body_text: The default setting is view height 180cm (equals to person with 195cm tall). It's too high for most of people. I want an edit able value to change first person view height. So that I don't need to create 3 views* (or more) for each view point. (* The three views are tall person, short person, and kid. )

title: Share "Packages" with Public Links (New Packages Feature in Docs)
body_text: The new Packages feature in docs is great, however because it doesn't allow the share of a public links, we will be stuck using the basic folders option which can be shared with public links. Thanks,

title: Notification for closed reviews
body_text: The situation is: A new member was added to the ACC and wants to see the previous "closed" reviews related to his trade to follow up the comments and notes mentioned inside the reviews. So, the idea is: Can we add a notification feature to the closed reviews to facilitate viewing the closed reviews? to the selected members that not involved in the review.

title: Longer timeframe for Activity logs in projects
body_text: The ACC project Activity log is a lifesaver for BIM Managers. However one year worth of records is not enough to capture the activities in a project. A project may be paused for a year and then all the records will be lost. We need a project lifetime log without timeframe. Also, the searching tool is archaic and restrictive. Searching events within a month data range takes longer. More flexibility is needed, longer range of time or full view of all records would help.

title: Automatic Process All File Versions of Migrated Data from BIM360
body_text: Hi, As you know, files transferred from BIM360 to ACC appear passive at first. Afterwards, we select these files and run the "Process" tool so that we can view and do other work on the files. When we bring files with more than one version, we cannot include all versions in the "Process" at once. We need to select the version and first "Make Current" and then "Process" it. This significantly increases the waste of time in files with multiple versions. It would be great if we could select all vers

title: Sort Projects By Type
body_text: On the Admin Projects Page could we add a column for "Project Type" that way I could sort by typology.

title: External web links for Docs
body_text: It'd be nice to have the ability to have shortcuts in Docs for external web links. Examples of where this may come into play is a link to a company CAD/BIM manual in SharePoint, or a client resource web page. My workaround now is to create a Word document and list the external links in it.

title: Make Roles Hierarchical
body_text: We keep our roles simple: owner, contractor, subcontractor, and vendor. I had a user request adding Project Engineer, Supt, Foreman, etc. The problem with this is that an individual can only be assigned a single role. Ideally, we would be able to have sub-roles within each of the four I listed above. This way they would not be excluded from notifications to their overall role and more detailed assignments could be made.

title: I suggest including a column or highlight in the project name indicating that there has been an update. Without relying solely on notification..
body_text: I suggest including a column or highlight in the project name indicating that there has been an update. Without relying solely on notification..

title: Printing multiple sheets at once
body_text: When viewing a sheet, you can select the ellipses menu in the top right to print the sheet. If you select multiple sheets, you only have the option to export those sheets. It would be helpful to have a print option under that export drop-down when you select multiple sheets.

title: Assign role to access all projects account
body_text: We would like the ability to assign roles and/or people permissions to access all projects set up in an account. This access would be done at the account admin level. Our Project Managers and senior leadership are used to being able to view information and files in every project the company is working on.

title: Forms Edit vs View Permissions
body_text: When setting up permission for a template, your "Edit" members are different than your "View" members, yet the editors are able to see all reports, even if they were not the ones to submit/create the form. Is there a way to lock the form so that Editors can create the form, but only viewers can view the forms?

title: Rearrange Sheet list to match Drawing Index
body_text: When you load drawings into "Sheets", it appears to place the drawings in chronological order, opposed to the order it appears in the Drawing index, i.e. Cover sheet listed 1st on the sheet index, but is populating after "A" sheets (architectural) due to sheet # beginning with a C or G. Is there a way to allow the drawings to be rearranged and locked so list of plans matches the sheet index opposed to chronological order?

title: Mobile App // Need a consistent experience between Android and iOS
body_text: There's not much more frustrating as a VDC Manager than to be looking at your device and trying to remotely guide someone else on their device, only to find the devices have slightly different user interfaces. While the ACC mobile app is pretty similar between Android and iOS platforms, there are still a number of notable differences. I use both Android and iOS regularly, and I must say that the Android ACC app is definitely the more polished app. The iOS app is still quite rough around the edge

title: Compare all page of two different PDF files instead of 1 to 1 comparison.
body_text: Currently, the capability is limited to comparing a single page of a PDF document with another. This process is labor-intensive and inefficient when attempting to identify updates within a multi-page PDF document. It would be highly beneficial if the ACC system could facilitate the comparison of two PDF documents in their entirety.

title: Submittal Markups - New file
body_text: The current process when reviewing a submittal is to click on the file make edits in the editor then save and a new file is generated under the current steps user/role assigned. Additionally, if the reviewer enters some comments but has not finished the review and saves the document, another document will be generated when going back in to make additional comments. Intuitively, users seem to want to click the copy to bring the file down to their review step, and I think this makes more sense. Wh

title: Allow images to be added as you create Issues
body_text: With BIM360, you were able to create an Issue then take an image and attach it to it. This workflow was used to create defect reports for both Interiors & Architectural teams. Now with ACC, you are required to have a Build subscription just to add an image to the Issue. For Architects & Interior Designers, having a Build subscription is pointless and the cost of it cannot be justified for the feature of being able to upload an image to an Issue. Give us the ability to add Images to Issues like w

title: Dark Background Option
body_text: In AutoCAD I had a black background to reduce eyestrain & could get through a 10+ hr day without much of an issue. Now within the first 90 min in ACC, I'm struggling with the white background & have had to add extensions to my browser to keep going. Could we please get a dark background option for the online, desktop, & mobile options please?

title: ACC Bridge Force Resync
body_text: ACC Bridge is too simple. Required more details and action buttons. ACC Bridge connects multiple Common Data Environment. It is also a tool to control incoming and outgoing based on the agreed path. However, the tools is too simple and if any synchronization is failed, the sync is skipped or not being copied to target folder. ACC Bridge need to include an action button for any sync failures or any path that requires a quick refresh. ACC Bridge also needs a report output to the Report log to reco

title: Team Communication Feature
body_text: Many of the ACC tools help remove the use of multiple types of software in managing project design by replacing the functions provided by other software. Team communication is not one of them yet, and it really ought to be. A chat/post system could replace Microsoft Teams and other such chat/team discussion spaces. Ideally, this would be best connected to the design teams created in Design Collaboration, as well as a shared chat/team discussion space in the Shared folder created or mapped as a p

title: PDF and Photo attachment for questions in the form of templates
body_text: It would be good if you could add PDFs or photos as additional information to the individual questions in the form templates. It should also be possible to view these on mobile devices. It would often be helpful for the person carrying out the work to receive additional information on a question in order to be able to fill out a checklist better. As far as I know, this function already existed in BIM 360. @Ap.Kofidis

title: As Built Export to include all versions of a file/sheet, not just the latest version
body_text: We need to keep a full record of every file/sheet that was uploaded to the platform throughout a project, in case of contractual disputes or other issues. Currently the As-Built Export in Build only enables export of the latest version of a file. This needs to include every version. Each version of each file should be downloaded into the zip folders, with '_v1, _v2, _v3' added to the end of the file name so we can look back at the activity log (coming soon?) to work out when it was uploaded/modi

title: File / Folder Link
body_text: Many of our users are expressing frustration with not being able to generate and share links through Windows File Explorer due to the "C:\Users\username" pathing. Being able to generate a link similar to how OneDrive functions would help. Could Autodesk explore and implement a solution to this? Thanks!

title: ACC Docs for windows ARM
body_text: Can you make ACC Desktop Connector for Docs working on a MacBook - Windows ARM? Now the installation still failing 😞

title: Show model name in element properties
body_text: When you click on an element in the viewer in the model coordination view, you can't distinguish which model the element is coming from. We need a consistent property for all elements that will show the model name in the element properties panel

title: Show file attributes for complete version history
body_text: Allow users to see attribute values for older versions of files in Docs.

title: Week numbers in build schedule
body_text: For some inexplicable reason, weeks are only shown with first and last dates instead of their week number. Idea: show weeks as week numbers.

title: Add Sheet Set Manager interface directly in ACC Web
body_text: Now that we have sheet set manager web, it would be great if you could manage sheet set properties directly in ACC. Many folks still use a well-known 3rd party tool to edit .dst files, but this capability should now be added to ACC Web so PMs and other non-cad users can manage sheet set properties and so users can have more controls over sheet sets outside of sheet set manger like that other 3rd party tool that's out there... It would also be great if we could add simple links to files that are

title: Notification for incomplete Syncs
body_text: A model was synced/uploaded with no issue. I can view the model in ACC (both Files/Docs and Model Coordination). However, I cannot use the Advanced Filters. When I opened Manage, fewer properties showed up. Support says this is a 'sync' issue. How am I to know that the model didn't sync correctly and is 'missing' data? I rely on Search Sets for Coordination. If I'm not getting all of my data, I can't trust my clashes. So what checks can be put in place? Because now I must check and verify every

title: Manage tool for account admins who manage users, rights and roles
body_text: I (try to) manage all projects across the board. For example, when a new colleague joins, they sometimes have to be added to 3,000 active projects. Or when role permissions change (due to a change of function), those permissions have to be adjusted across all (more than 5,000) active projects. Can a tool be created to manage active projects and in particular users, roles, folder rights for account admins?

title: ACC Submittals: Reviewer Dates Missing in Excel Export
body_text: Current Limitation: In Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC) Submittals, reviewer-related date information (such as review start date, response date, or reviewer action dates) is correctly captured within the platform and is also available when exporting submittal data to PDF format. However, when exporting the same submittal data to Excel, these reviewer date fields are not included in the Excel output. Business Impact: This limitation makes it difficult for project teams to perform reporting, trac

title: Add Title/Role field when adding members
body_text: We use our phone list generated from ACC to place in our O&M manuals at the the end of the project, we also throughout the project will create a phone list for site to reference, it would be extremely helpful if we could input the members title so we know who to call for certain situations. Please, pretty please, make this happen!!!!???

title: Forms - Edit list of default templates in template creation
body_text: When creating a new template->"Build a new form"->"Select a starting template" the user is presented with a list of templates to start a template creation from. This list must be editable in some way, at least to project admins who would be able to add or remove starting templates suggestions from this list. These starting templates are key when developing large sets of templates that have commonalities such as project details pages, signature pages, table pages and such which would be common ov

title: Undo Last Function Option - Building Connected
body_text: Would it be possible to get an "undo last function"-type action added somewhere in the BC Pro platform? If you accidentally delete something, there is no method of retrieving the data. Bidders are fairly easy to accidentally delete from a Bidder List during the creation process. It would be nice to be able to "go back" or "undo".

title: Assets Filtering Save option like Docs
body_text: Assets Filtering Save option like Docs for private and shared searches.

title: Build Sheet Disciplines should apply to Revit Model Sheets in Docs
body_text: Currently, Build > Sheets allows you to customize the sort order and what letters are used for Disciplines. When viewing PDFs in docs or a Revit model in Docs, the setup for Build > Sheets does not come through. It would be great to set the Disciplines once and have it apply to both Docs and Build.

title: Issues placement in Docs vs Build
body_text: Currently, if you place an Issue on a Build> Sheet, it registers that placement to the sheet in Build. If you've gone through the effort to select the Sheets to publish in Revit to ACC, then in Docs> Publish to Build> Sheets, then place an issue on the Sheet in Build, the Issue placement is registered to the sheet in Build. This means it does not go back to the sheet in the model on Docs, which also means it does not show up in Revit via the ACC Issues Plugin. If there is a workflow to go Revit>

title: Customizable Cover Page for Reports
body_text: It would be nice to have a customizable text box on the cover page of a report. This is important for issue detail reports (punch reports) that apply to specific areas but not the whole project and also for being able to include some default legal language without having to edit the pdf of the report after the fact. For a current program we have, typically we will see 10+ reports generated per project and there are hundreds of projects, so eliminated a repetitive task at scale would be a wonderf

title: Assets - Edit Assets in table format
body_text: Edit Assets in table format, similar to exporting out to excel - having both options would benefit. At the moment the team have to individually click on each Asset and update where sometimes the team prefer Excel like features.

title: Insight Builder - data refresh time frequency increase
body_text: The current setting of data refresh of 5am and 5pm for EU servers is not sufficient to actively track activities. We currently try to track completion of sections in forms. If a colleague completes their section it will not be shown until the next morning that this section is complete. We would like to increase the data refresh time - the best case would be a "live tracking", however, at least 2-3 more updates during the day would already be helpful.

title: Offer the option to generate reports showing all user license types (AEC, Docs, Build, etc.) and allocations (internal or external)
body_text: Current Issue: ACC Account Admin does not allow a detailed report of users that includes their license type, or if they are managed internally or externally. The only details that are currently reportable, are "Project", "Status", and "Last Sign In". This does not allow Account Admin to fully monitor/manage usage across projects. Proposed Solution: Allow Account Admins to generate a full report, reflecting the license types (AEC, Docs, Build, etc.) and license allocations (internal or external)

title: Show allocation for AEC Collection (SO-3051) in the Member Subscription section on ACC Account Admin
body_text: Current Issue: ACC Account Admin does not show if a user has an external AEC Collection (SO-3051) license. This leads to the account admin not knowing if the user needs a license assigned, or they already have their own externally managed license. Expected Outcome 1: ACC Account Admin reports if a user has an external AEC Collection (SO-3051) license. This will allow account admins to see if a user has an externally managed AEC Collection (SO-3051) license. Expected Outcome 2: Additional section

title: Review stamp
body_text: We should be able to define the default stamp size.

title: PDF title block attribute updates
body_text: Extraction of title block attributes (Beta): Excellent feature. However, it needs improvement for multipage PDFs—when a multipage PDF contains different sheet formats, recognition does not work.

title: Variable data field in a naming standard
body_text: We would need a data field type in the naming standard that - if changed - does not taken into account on the decision whether a document is a new file or a new version of an older file. This would be extremely important in terms of revisions - which is usually part of a naming standard but its change does not mean that we are uploading a fully new file. Example: 1. [Project Code] - [Design phase] - [Building Code] - [Discipline] - [Level] - [Document type] - [Running number] -R01 _ [Descriptive

title: 3D Connexion Spacemouse support for ACC
body_text: 3DConnexion - Spacemice are used in the industry by many colleagues. The support on Inventor, Fusion and Revit has been out for a long time. ACC (&Bim360) is missing this feature. It can be supported with web-based applications as other companies integrate this flawlessly. SDK's are publicly available to integrate this feature in ACC. https://3dconnexion.com/tw/service/ https://3dconnexion.com/us/software-developer-program/ Already mentioned in: https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/bim-360-team-forum/

title: Forms Approval Workflow
body_text: There should be an option to require multiple reviewers to sign off on a form. At our company, some of our forms use a reviewer sequence in which specific people review in a predetermined order. We currently work around this by using the sequential editors function and having people manually assign the form to the next person in the list, with the penultimate person submitting it for review to the final reviewer. It would be fantastic to automate this workflow. There are other functionalities th

title: Files: Status-based permissions
body_text: Hello there, I’d like to share a (in my opinion) quite revolutionary idea how to completely transform the Files tool and the current role based permission system. Right now we’re stuck with the default Autodesk system, it definitely has its advantages, but in my opinion this is not how a real CDE should work in 2025. Let’s finally revolutionize how we work in the Files tool. Instead of complicated folder structures where every folder/subfolder has different role/company/user based permissions, l

title: Viewer 3D - Rooms visible
body_text: In BIM 360, 5 years ago, rooms were visible in 3D. After it was deactivated. (In power BI, with the SVF viewer, it's possible to see in 3D the rooms). Autodesk now has a stragegy for the data inside ACC. Rooms elements have a lot of useful data for client, designers, construction teams... (area, perimeter, finishes, department...), these data are useful to track the program, the finishes quantities... and to track the work progress on site. It would be great and really useful to have an option t

title: Enable Users to Create Custom Work Types in Plan Tasks in Autodesk Build
body_text: Allow users to create custom work types in task plans of Autodesk Build. Work plans could be used for any workflow within the AEC industries, why do work plan types need to be restricted to just construction delivery? The following work types are limited in their usage: Work Delivery Inspection Roadblock Safety Downtime

title: Allow desktop PDF comments to be synced with ACC markups
body_text: Many users in our organization prefer to add comments using PDF viewers like Acrobat, PDF Xchange, or even Nitro, rather than using ACC's markups. In addition, when we make those comments in a PDF, we expect a user to be able to look them up in ACC for file history comparison. However, since those comments are not considered as markups by ACC, but as part of the whole PDF, it is impossible to rely on comments made outside of ACC markup tools. A big boost to our reviews and comments would be to b

title: Dataset needed for References in Autodesk Construction Cloud
body_text: Current Challenge: There are currently no datasets available in the Data Connector for “References” used across modules in Autodesk Construction Cloud. This limitation makes it difficult to extract and visualize interlinked data efficiently in dashboards or external BI tools. Industry Application: We require an extensive dataset that includes References across modules so dashboards can include clickable links between related items such as f orms, RFIs, submittals, photos, and issues. Example Use

title: Enable creation of Insight Dashboards in Project Templates.
body_text: Enable users to create predefined Insight Dashboards within Project Templates, as it is cumbersome to recreate them for every project.

title: Manually rearrange photos in forms
body_text: It would be very helpful if we could rearrange the uploaded photos after attaching them to a form. Being able to set the desired order improves clarity and organization.

title: Issues Full View Visibility but Limited Assignment Options
body_text: It would be nice to split out and have independent controls on issues permissions based on visibility and assignment. For my use case, I want a specific role to be able to see all issues (help prevent duplicates) but only be able to assign to their company. Current state to see all issues you then have rights to assign to anyone. Short term it could be solved by adding an entire company as a watcher, but unless you use templates (and depend on the user to select the template), there isn't a way

title: Make specifications visible in issues in the app version
body_text: Specifications is a great way to mark parts of files. However, they're not visible in the issues in the app version. Specifications connected to an issue are very handy for the people on the construction site. That way they don't have to scroll through dozens of pages and only get to see the relevant information.

title: Review template reports
body_text: In the reports feature, we have the ability to create reports on many things, but not on reviews. Is this something that will be available soon? The aim is to gather all information from a review and send it to the subcontractor if necessary.

title: Add ability to Void or Retract a Sent Transmittal (Optionally add Comments after sending)
body_text: Currently, once a transmittal has been issued in Autodesk Construction Cloud, there is no way to void, retract, or comment on a transmittal. This creates major issues when a transmittal is sent in error, for example: Wrong recipients added (confidential documents sent externally). Incorrect documents included. Administrative errors that need to be corrected for compliance records. Since ACC treats transmittals as immutable, the only workaround is to issue a new transmittal referencing the mistak

title: Automatically apply default role when creating a new project
body_text: Currently, when a user with a default role (e.g., "Project Admin") creates a new project, their role is not automatically applied to the project they created. Instead, they must manually assign their role after project creation via "Project Admin > Members". This behavior differs from when the same user is invited to a project by others, where the default role is automatically applied. We believe that automatically applying the default role upon project creation would improve user experience and

title: Eliminate the need to Publish Revit Models to my own Team
body_text: What is the purpose of publishing a model to my own team? Why not allow members of my own team to view the live models in the Docs viewer. The publishing process could be reserved for milestone records, while still maintaining a publish set so Revit users can choose which views and sheets are visible in the viewer. The ability to share models with broader teams/disciplines, for coordination workflows in BIM Collaborate Pro or asset workflows in Autodesk Build can still remain, to ensure appropri

title: Issues
body_text: Currently, Account Admins are unable to view issues created by other users when those issues are in an Unpublished state. We would like Account Admins to have visibility of all Unpublished issues to help identify and rectify discrepancies between issue counts shown in the Insights Dashboard and the actual data in the project. This would improve accuracy and transparency in project reporting and issue management.

title: Enhancement on Assets
body_text: 1.Permission The permissions should be more specific to the field, user that update status (eg. framing is done) should not be able to update specifics on the asset (eg. location, apartment type). 2. Custom field Can they create a template to import them as they do for everything else? These are the important one, they should be color coded When you export the multiselect come as a single field with all the selections, they should come as different columns 3.Interface Asset details are not as im

title: Extension of Rows in Location Template
body_text: Use Case : In residential projects, especially high-rise developments, each tower consists of multiple locations across various floors and zones. The current row limit of 9,999 in the location template is insufficient to accommodate such large-scale project structures. As multiple towers with several locations significantly increase the total count, this limitation restricts accurate and comprehensive location mapping. Suggestion: I recommend extending the row limit in the project location templ

title: Sort By Severity
body_text: Kind of amazing that this is still not an option, on this platform. In an average month I find hundreds of issues on numerous projects, and one of the most common requests is to order the report by severity. When I walk a site it would be swell if I could just create the issues as I see them and later sort them by severity. But no. How is this even something I need to ask for?

title: Add likes and reactions across entire ACC
body_text: Add the same reactions across entire ACC like in Outlook emails - photo attached. This morning I wanted hit like on one RFI, but I realized I could not. We are using these reactions in outlook, I think your users would like this option on ACC as well.

title: Permissions for Sheets
body_text: In the current Autodesk ACC setup, the Sheets function automatically grants V iew access to all project members by default. This can create problems in projects where some members require access to the Build module but should not have visibility of drawings — for example, certain subcontractors, field workers, or external collaborators who only need access to specific construction data or tasks. Introduce the ability to customize permissions for the Sheets module , similar to how permissions can

title: Forms - Bulk Export
body_text: Having the ability to bulk export forms as separate files (zip folder) instead of it being in one big pdf

title: ACC Admin - Ability to correct first and last name of a member
body_text: It would be helpful to have the ability to correct a contact's first and last name in the ACC Admin module. We sometimes have old school folks that don't want to deal with the minutia of data on our CM system, but we pull the name as a custom attribute on documentation like change order requests. If they were added at the beginning of our ACC use, the name appears as the first section of their email twice. For example, nryder nryder is listed as one of our client's name on change order requests.

title: Sub Issues
body_text: Would it be possible to have issues related to issues? or Muli-Step issues? We would like the ability to have one issue get used to manage mulitiple steps to a problem- ex for Drywall damage we could have an issue assigned to the drywaller, and once their scope of work is complete have it get assigned to the painter so they could re-paint the area.

title: No issue creation for certain roles
body_text: As a construction manager, I would like certain roles (e.g. subcontructor, clients) to be unable to create issues, even for their own company. The issues are included in the issue list and make it more confusing for me. This can also distort the results when evaluating the issues.

title: E-Signature Expand Default Contact Options
body_text: @ian_turner I talked with you about this at AU 2025. Would like to see the default list of e-signers for subcontracts (suppliers) expanded to included all the "additional contacts" from the supplier details section: Also, we would like "Additional contacts" concept added to the Company Setup Section in Cost Management Settings for at least the Owner, Contractor, and Architect Sections. Then apply these to the default list for e-signers. We often have several people who need to initial and/or sig

title: Email Alias for Notifications
body_text: We struggle to get our internal users and external users to keep notification emails out of their other or junk boxes since the email address comes from Autodesk. Can the email notifications come through as an email alias so that it appears to come from the user who generated the notification?

title: ACC - Insight Builders -Cross-filter visual with custom attributes
body_text: We have issues with multiple customised fields. In insight Builders it's not possible to cross filter visuals with these custom attributes. In the dataset "Issue with custom attribut", every attribute value is a row and we don't have a way to pivot the table in insight Builder. Possible to add a fonction to pivot the tables ? With Power BI & data connector, it's possible to do it.

title: ACC Cost Management - Supports for Taiwan Region
body_text: Summary: ACC Cost Management currently does not support different decimal settings for ‘quantity’, ‘rate’ and ‘amount’. This creates compliance issues in Taiwan, where by law all monetary amounts must be rounded to the nearest whole New Taiwan Dollar (0 d.p.), while ‘quantities’ still require decimals (eg: 0.123456) Impact: According to Article 14 of the Value-Added and Non-Value-Added Business Tax Act, all amounts must be rounded to the nearest New Taiwan Dollar as Taiwan’s smallest currency un

title: Display Review Workflow Participants in File Metadata (Docs)
body_text: Hello. I would like to suggest a feature enhancement for the Docs module that would significantly improve transparency and traceability in the review process. Feature Request: Enable the automatic display of the following information in the file metadata for documents submitted through the review workflow: Initiator of the review Reviewers Final Approver Current Limitation: At present, this information is not automatically visible in the file metadata once a review is completed. While the review

title: Discipline Auto-Population for ACC Labor (Forms)
body_text: Enable ACC Forms (specifically labor-related forms) to have predefined discipline pick lists and auto-population capabilities so users don’t need to manually type disciplines each time. Current Limitation: Currently, when filling out labor forms, users must type in the discipline field manually. This leads to inconsistencies (different spellings, abbreviations, typos e.g., “MEP” vs. “Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing”). It slows down form completion and reduces reporting accuracy across projects. P

title: Enhancing File Management Efficiency in ACC: Quick Access Target Folder Feature
body_text: Currently, when copying files within ACC, users must manually navigate through multiple layers to select the target folder—often repeating this process for frequently used destinations. This slows down workflows and creates unnecessary friction, especially for high-volume or time-sensitive tasks. Proposed Solution: Introduce a “Quick Access” feature that allows users to pre-select and pin frequently used target folders. When initiating a file copy, these folders would appear as shortcuts, enabli

title: Roles activate/ de-activate regarding to project needs
body_text: Roles could be possible to activate/ de-activate regarding to project needs. Quicker overview when setting up permission or starting correspondences.

title: Feature Request: Allow Non-Project Members to Upload Files
body_text: In the Autodesk Docs environment, it should be possible to request file uploads from external parties , even if they are not part of the project . The background is that external partners or contractors often cannot be added as project members due to compliance or security restrictions . The feature could work similarly to the existing file transfer to non-project members , but in the opposite direction: upload instead of download . This would allow external parties to securely provide specific

title: Ability to Close the Cost Payment Application Month
body_text: I would like to be able to close the cost payment application month, so that subcontractors can not submit a pay request in a previous month.

title: There is no version number visible in markups tab
body_text: When you go to the markups tab within the document, the version is not visible, only the date when the markup was left, so you have no way of knowing what version the markup was left on, especially since you do have the option to leave markups on the old versions. This is extremely important for the review process, and is such a downgrade from BIM360!

title: Request to Customize Meeting Minutes
body_text: Is it possible to remove the footers and headers from all pages of the Autodesk Minutes? I've highlighted them in yellow for reference. The first PDF we issued felt cluttered, and removing these should help clean it up.

title: Make the Job Title available for use in an ACC database
body_text: Currently, within the ACC Profile, the Job Title data element is not actively used in ACC. According to Autodesk, it may be used in future product initiatives and by internal organizations. Also, there have been discussions with the User Profile team on their data syncing, but it's still in the discussion phase and they have no estimate as to when that might change. While the use of Roles is very effective at managing, controlling, and executing Reviews within ACC, they tend to be associated wit

title: Enable Sync of Folder Attributes Across Projects in ACC Docs Bridge
body_text: Use Case Scenario: A project team shares a folder (with all its files) from one project (source) to another project (target) using the "Bridge - Share to Target Project" feature. The folder structure and files successfully appear in the target project. However, the folder attributes and their applied values , which are already configured in the source project, do not transfer to the target project. Current Limitation / Problem Statement: Even when "Automatically sync updates to target project" i

title: Content Catalog in ACC – Not Efficient for Revit Authors
body_text: The current Content Catalog in Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC) is not efficient when used in combination with Revit. From the perspective of a Revit author, the workflow of browsing, filtering, and loading families into projects is slow and cumbersome compared to other available solutions. There are multiple third-party browsers that allow much faster access, better filtering, drag-and-drop functionality, and the option to load only the required family types. These tools integrate more seamles

title: merge two autodesk accounts
body_text: Now it is not possible to merge two autodesk accounts: https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/Is-it-possible-to-merge-two-BIM-360-ACC-accounts.html Sometimes a user have multiple domains and mailadresses. It will be good if a user can merge accounts.

title: Add "Hour" option in Forms
body_text: For forms that require more detail than just a date, it would be very useful to have the option to capture the time as well. This way, the information isn’t limited to free-form text entries, which may vary in format, but instead can be standardized and included in reports. For example, in the case of a safety incident, being able to record the location, date, and time of occurrence is critical.

title: Progress Updation Against Schedule Line Items / Deliverables in ACC Schedule Module
body_text: Background & Current Limitation: At present, the Schedule module in ACC only provides a view of the planned schedule and dependencies but does not support capturing actual progress against schedule line items or deliverables. This makes the module functionally limited to a static scheduling tool rather than a live progress tracking solution. In real construction projects, schedules are not just meant to outline planned dates but are critical instruments for tracking and reporting the actual prog

title: Project Member to Account Member migration
body_text: When a new member is added to a project and one of my team adds this new member, to include Company and Role, ALL of that information shjould carry over to the Account MEmber section. Currently, the only thing that transfers to the Account Member section is their name, Access LEvel and Date Added. I then have to go into the Account Admin section, access Account Members, and add it all again. That is insane and very time consuming. No, having an Autodesk Build Member Adder is not a new job positi

title: Automatic transfer to Account the company and role info when adding users at project level
body_text: When a new user is added directly at the project level, which is what happens mostly during day to day work, their Company and Role details should automatically populate and update at the account level without needing manual re-entry by the account admins. This saves time and ensures accurate, centralized user records and prevents mismatches between project and account data.

title: Compare multiple documents at a time
body_text: Add the option to compare more than 2 documents at a time, and compare the whole document, not page by page

title: Files - make ´Version added at´ as default attribute
body_text: Recently you have developed long awaited and needed attribute ´Version added at´ which shows when files were uploaded to ACC. This info is available only in excel export ´Files log report´, but not on ACC. Why? Pls add this as default attribute asap.

title: Hyperlink to folder to match file path
body_text: When coping link to folder, make Hyperlink to folder to match file path. Currently it is only shown as ''Files - Autodesk Build''. I would like: DATA4 FRA1\Project Files\01. Client Files\01.05. Tenant SOQ\2025-01-13 SOQ Evidence\2024-11-19_Aktualisierte Abgabe SOQ V2 This might seem like somethin insignificant, but I can assure you that we share links to ACC folders at least 100 times per day and it would be great if we can actually see what we are sharing, instead of ''Files - Autodesk Build''.

title: Docs - Reviews - filter per key reviewer or add watchers
body_text: As there are no watchers in reviews, we have to use optimal reviewers to give access to companies. Then our reviewers cannot filter what is in their court because they are added to everything. Please add filtering option: key reviewer and optional reviewer. Or even better add watchers to reviews as this option already exist in RFIs and Submittals.

title: Allow all project members to view permissions in FILES
body_text: On ACC Build and DOCS, only Project Admins are able to view and edit the permission levels associated with each role for each folder and sub-folder. In our projects, we have a complex folder structure with several project members. It would assist us if all project members were able to view the permission levels associated with each role for each folder and sub-folder on ACC Build and DOCS.

title: Correspondence Template
body_text: In the event of repeated emails, that the field folks would like to communicate to the site, it would be efficient to create templates for these correspondences rather than re-writing each message and re-selecting all applicable parties.

title: Option for stamps to follow when a file is moved or copied to a different folder
body_text: Currently Stamps on drawings do not follow when files are moved or copied from one file to another. All other meta data travels with it, why not stamps? We would like an option, for us to decide based on project needs if a stamp sticks to the drawing or not, this could be part of the stamp settings so you could have different stamps for different purposes and properties.

title: Share Issue Templates from Other Build Sites
body_text: Add the ability to share Issue Templates from other Build project site via an import function or by Excel export and import.

title: Submittals - Option to change the Responsible Contractor to a role instead of the single creator
body_text: When a submittal is created, the creator's name appears under the Responsible Contractor by name and not by role. It would be great to have the option for the role of that person to appear instead. On our projects, we have several people assigned to a specific role that is responsible for submittals. Therefore, it would assist us if all members assigned to that role could act as the Responsible Contractor on any submittal that is created by someone in that role. This would ensure that the submit

title: ACC Build - Improve window to edit watchers
body_text: On certain tools in ACC Build such as Issues, RFIs and Submittals, the window to assign watchers is currently small and difficult to navigate. It would be useful to improve the window which allows for editing information (including watchers) to the tool. This would assist in making it easier, clearer and will reduce the risk of errors occuring.

title: Dynamic Folder Views by File attributes
body_text: It would be great to have the possibility to change the folder view dynamic using meta-attributes from Files. Example: Define a new folder structure with "Status"-Attribute as first tree and "WBS" as second tree It should be possible to preconfigure as admin these dynamic folder views and share them with the users. At the same time, it would complete the request if we could setup permission settings on files utilising Meta-Attributes.

title: Reopen Submit Section
body_text: We would like to raise feature request for reopen submit section in Form. Currently, we cannot reopen the the section if we have mistakenly submit the section

title: RFI Types - Ability to edit after creation
body_text: In the RFI module, I (admin/manager) do not have the ability to edit the “RFI Type” once a creator has sent it to me. 99% of the time whoever is writing the RFI doesn’t select a Type and it just goes to the Default review process, but that always needs to be edited based on the RFI. But because I can’t edit this, I have to send it back to their court where sometimes even they can’t change it, meaning they have to delete the RFI, start over, and send it back to me after I’ve explained which RFI T

title: Make description attribute in Files mandatory
body_text: Make the description attribute in Files mandatory. Can we make this option available for other attributes too (e.g. the custom attributes)?

title: Advanced Export Formatting for Docs
body_text: When exporting files from Docs, it should be possible to define folder-specific export standards . These should allow f lexible formatting, including mixed or no delimiters between attributes (e.g. AttributeA_AttributeB-AttributeCAttributeD). This enables automatic, structured file names, where users only need to add additional parameters if needed. Such flexibility is increasingly important, as many clients require strict, predefined naming conventions for deliverables.

title: Role-Based Access for Title Block Templates Needed
body_text: Currently, only project admins can create and manage Title Block Templates . To improve flexibility, permissions should be assignable to specific roles or users , just like with the Package Manager . This allows selected team members (e.g., BIM or CAD leads) to manage templates without full admin rights — enabling more efficient, decentralized workflows.

title: One Template for All: Optimizing Title Block Positioning
body_text: To avoid creating a separate title block template for each drawing size, the origin point for reading parameters automatically should be set at the bottom right corner of the title block. This ensures that parameter positions remain consistent across different sheet dimensions, enabling a single, scalable template for all formats. By standardizing the reference point, we simplify template management, reduce redundancy, and improve efficiency in the drawing workflow.

title: Autodesk Takeoff - Enable Move-by-Vertex and Snap-to-Takeoff for Existing Takeoff Objects
body_text: In Autodesk Takeoff, once a takeoff object is placed, there’s no way to move it by selecting a specific vertex and snapping it to another point. The only option is to move the entire object manually, which prevents precise alignment — especially when trying to connect to an existing takeoff (e.g., adjacent paving, curb lines, or slab edges). We need the ability to: Grab and move a takeoff object using a selected vertex Snap that vertex to another takeoff's endpoint or edge Maintain alignment acc

title: ACC Browser - Allow for viewing of KMZ and TXT file types
body_text: In the ACC Browser, it would be great if file types such as KMZ's and TXT files are supported. Currently, files in this format can be uploaded and downloaded but cannot be opened through the ACC Browser. It would be helpful to be able to open and view files with this format in the ACC browser, without having to download them.

title: MEETINGS - Feature Request List
body_text: We have a list of features that currently are preventing us from making the switch to ACC meetings. It would be great to see these get added to the roadmap and in the future so that we can actually start using it. The potential is there but OneNote is still holding as the stronger software for now for us Colored text and/or a better way of knowing what information is from the previous meeting vs the current meeting Paste pictures from clipboard When we are live in a meeting, the time to save, na

title: exporting review workflow setting report
body_text: It's very important for admin to have a clear overview of "who have been assigned as key reviewer/optional review for each review workflow". for Now, you have to go to review workflow to check the settings individually, if you have a lot of workflow, it can get quite confusing. Like the file log export function, it should also have an export function showing all the review workflow in the project.

title: Remove Automatic Filters on Issues
body_text: Autodesk recently implemented automatic filters that hide closed issues by default. This has been a largely negative change for our company, as we need to see closed issues for reference and reporting. Having to manually switch the filters off per user per project is not a feasible solution. We would like a way to disable this auto-filter company-wide.

title: Custom Fields - Need More Options
body_text: Currently there are 4 types of custom fields - simple text, dropdown (single select), dropdown (multi select) and number. This is not enough in my experience. The following custom fields would be extremely helpful: Date (Calendar Picker) Rich Text - just like we have here when submitting ideas Checkbox User From Members List - to indicate a specific person for a specific assignment (field contact, supervisor, etc).

title: ACC Build Fonts /  Review Signatures
body_text: It would be helpful to have the ability to preset the font for Build items within account admin settings or within the ACC project template. The company I work for has standardized fonts for all documentation which is not currently changeable within Build. For example, when entering information in Forms, all text defaults to Helvetica and all RFI/Submittal exports are in a predefined font as well. Being able to adjust all Font defaults for Forms and exports would save time and help with cohesive

title: Asset Reference on Sheet
body_text: Hello, Since the introduction of the asset systems feature, we have been using it extensively. However, I miss the ability to reference systems to a sheet in the same way as assets, so they can be directly clickable and traceable. Is it possible to include this in a future release? Best regards Chris

title: Bulk User Assignment in ACC Projects
body_text: As we currently manage a large number of projects in ACC, I’ve noticed that adding users to multiple projects can be quite time-consuming. When a user requests access to several projects, I have to manually add them to each project one by one, which significantly slows down the process.

title: Sharing files from mobile app
body_text: At the momnet, there is no way to share or download files directly from the ACC mobile app. This severely limits site teams, who depend on their phones and tablets for the vast majority of their work. Forcing them to return to a desktop just to perform a basic task adds unnecessary delays, reduces productivity, and undermines the efficiency that mobile workflows are meant to provide. Enabling file sharing and downloading within the mobile app would be a huge step forward for supporting field tea

title: Automatically extract revision date from drawing
body_text: Can you develop some automation or AI tool so we can have the latest revision date automatically updated in attributes on ACC? Please see how revision history table looks like on our drawings. Revision date changes every time and we cannot use your option ´´Extract pages and attributes´´. There is a new attribute you developed ´´Version added on´´, but only in the files log excel export, not as an attribute. So nothing so far on ACC can help us, we still have to manually add revision date as an

title: Suggestion: Improve the “Share” Feature in ACC Docs Files—Copy Links with Document Name as Friendly Text
body_text: Dear team, I’d like to highlight a major user experience blocker in ACC when using its Files sharing function (within the Docs tool), which significantly limits the platform’s value as a Common Data Environment (CDE) and Electronic Document Management System (EDMS). Current Issue: When using the “Share” option to copy a file or folder link, only the raw URL is copied. This means when users paste the link—for example, into an Outlook email—there’s no “friendly” display text attached (like the doc

title: Autodesk Takeoff - Improve symbol detection to recognize rotated or slanted symbols
body_text: The current symbol detection in Autodesk Takeoff only works on symbols that are perfectly horizontal or match the original reference exactly. If a symbol is even slightly rotated, mirrored, or placed on a slant (which happens all the time in real construction plans), it’s completely ignored. This defeats the purpose of automating takeoff for repetitive elements like fixtures or callouts. Please improve symbol detection by: Allowing for a rotation tolerance (e.g. ±10 degrees) Recognizing mirrored

title: Copy and Paste Asset Locations to Different Sheets
body_text: Often, I have the same drawing for multiple plans, it would be helpful if I could simply drag over all of the assets in one sheet and then copy and paste them to my mechanical or plumbing drawings.

title: Docs
body_text: Dear Sir or Madam, Recently, we started using the ACC function "Issues" and were quite satisfied with it. A couple of weeks later, an update seems to have been implemented, so that now in the mandatory field "Title," the name can be typed in, but it is always pre-filled with the "Type" value. Many users think they do not need to enter anything there because it is already filled in. As a result, we receive an overview of issues that all have the same name; how are we supposed to differentiate the

title: [Files] Ability to turn on shareable links in company templates
body_text: We share files via links in all of our projects and currently we need to enable this on any newly created projects. Having the ability to enable this and set the expiration time via a template would be great.

title: Summary Reports for Trasmittal or Insight Dashboard for Trasmittal Summary view
body_text: To better overall managment control of the project, It would be beneficial to have a summary report or to include in the cover of the existing export report from trasmittal tab or have as defualt dashboard inside Insight the following information about trasmittal: - total n. of trasmittal send by each Company (sender) to each Company (not mentioning single adressee, but filtering by Company); - total n. of file send by each Company (sender) to each Company (not mentioning single adressee, but fi

title: TradeTapp - Readers for COI and OSHA 300A submissions
body_text: It would be helpful if when a COI was uploaded by a contractor, there was a reader that filled in amounts like the financial section does. So many people enter it wrong. Likewise the same for OSHA 300A logs. Since they are standard formats, it would be helpful. I would prefer to review everything the same way financials are where you have a left side that contains their input and a right side that contains the corresponding document. I have to send back so many applications because they do not e

title: Improved view of Workshop XR
body_text: The model view in ACC looks different from the view in the XR space. The model view in ACC is clear, but in the XR space, it does not look realistic and the colors appear white, making it hard to see. It is also difficult to check the details of the parts. Currently, there are no settings for Workshop XR. Could this be improved, please?

title: Issues Tool
body_text: Able to export Issues summary (in excel) - all Issues and not limited to 10,000 issues only.

title: Spell Check in the Building Connected Message Module
body_text: It woudl be cool to be able to have spell check when we send out messages through the Building Connected module.

title: Build - Submittals - due date in red color if overdue
body_text: We would like ´Due date´ to turn red when the date is overdue. Advanced level is to add new fields: overdue number of calendar days, overdue number of working days, overdue number of weeks.

title: Feature Request: Copy Sub-folders across different parent folders within same project
body_text: Dear Autodesk R&D Team, I would like to propose a Copy Sub-Folder feature that allows users to duplicate sub-folder structures across different parent folders. In my project, I manage 30-40 different buildings , each requiring a standardized folder structure. Currently, I have to manually add sub-folders to each building folder, which is both time-consuming and repetitive. A feature that enables the copying of sub-folders into different parent folders would significantly streamline this process,

title: Bulk actions
body_text: Create more bulk actions in Build: Bulk tagging of photos .....

title: Bulk Export of Files — including Published Markups — at Project or Folder Level in Handover / As-Built
body_text: Problem Statement During project close-out we must deliver weekly “as-built” document packages that include all published markups on PDFs. Under the current Handover workflow: Only Sheets support markup export; Files do not . The former Settings-based As-Built export (which did include file markups) has been removed. Our workaround is to multi-select every file inside each folder and export them one batch at a time. Complex projects often contain dozens of nested folders ; repeating this process

title: Un-void RFI's
body_text: Instead of created a duplicate of a voided RFI it would be great to have the ability to UN void an RFI and reopen it for review.

title: Submittal due dates
body_text: Could you make it so that there is a way to set Submittal due dates so that they don't fall on a weekend, rather than going in each time and manually changing the due date?

title: Activating and setting up collections in a Project Template
body_text: Many of my clients find themselves creating the same collections over and over when a project is started. Having that option as part of a template would save a lot of time.

title: Be able to send Transmittal to additional people after initial send
body_text: After you send a transmittal, I don't see any way to send that same transmittal to additional people. Sometimes we miss someone that needs the transmittal also. Sometimes someone new is added to the team (either in ACC or outside of ACC) that needs the Transmittal. I don't want to have to create a whole new transmittal just to send the same thing to someone else. Thank you!.

title: Quick add additional images for ACC Issues
body_text: I'd like to see an option to add additional images to the ACC Issues functionality. When creating an issue, the system creates the initial screenshot, but I would like the ability to take additional viewpoints either through a direct button or via the Saved Viewpoints window. Both would be huge as you could add more context to the issue quickly. The current workflow is to take snapshots via a third-party software, save them to your hard drive, then upload them as references. It's time consuming

title: Meetings Tab within Docs
body_text: It'd be nice to be able to access meeting minutes from the Docs webpage. I have to switch over to Build or Model Coordination to access our meetings and it would save a click to be able to access it in Docs as well.

title: Model Coordination - Filter and Configuration
body_text: It would be good if the filters/configuration could also be saved under the project template. Currently you always have to make these settings for each project.

title: Automatic snapshot when an issue is set to "Closed"
body_text: When you create an issue on ACC Model Coordination, there is an automatic snapshot of the issue created. It would be nice to get an automatic snapshot when the issue is set to "Closed" as well. That way there is visual evidence that the issue was solved at the time it was set to "Closed".

title: Open Sheet in New Tab
body_text: I usually need to reference or compare multiple sheets at once. Right now it seems the only way to open a sheet is in my current browser tab, opening the sheet in that tab takes me away from the sheet list. To open another sheet, I have to relaunch ACC Build in a new tab and renavigate through my folder structure to get back to the sheet list. This takes so much longer than it needs to and gets tedious really quickly. If I could instruct sheets to open in new tabs from the sheet list instead, le

title: Edit Member name
body_text: There should be a way to edit the member's first and last name, outside of the "Add Member" screen.

title: Display and Filter Sheets with Assets in Web View
body_text: In the ACC App, a symbol indicates whether there are asset markings in a sheet. Additionally, it is possible to filter all sheets that contain assets. Unfortunately, this is not possible in the web view. It would be very helpful to quickly see if there are assets in a sheet and to filter by them in the web view as well. ACC APP: ACC WEB:

title: Document Created Date
body_text: Within ACC Files/Docs we cannot see the original/created at date for documents that were uploaded. We can only see the modified date on the web. When navigating through the desktop connector and Windows file explorer we can toggle on the created at date but we cannot see it in the web.

title: Limits of the system
body_text: The limits of the system allow to upload pdf with maximum 2000 pages. We currently have some technical documents with more than 2000 pages. Is it possible to increase the limit of the system? The idea would be to have a limit at 5000 pages. Thanx for your answer.

title: make form creation smarter
body_text: give us the possibility to use ACC project value like "plangrid_user_full_name" for automatic naming of forms. the goal is to get a consistent naming and avoid errors. In my case i want in addition the possibility to set specific date format - JJJJCWXX BR Markus

title: Create a "Contact Admin" button
body_text: Would like users without admin privilege's to have a button to contact their admin for licensing or permissions changes. Would be good to have this include ability for an account to turn off/off, add assigning of admins by groups etc.

title: Retain Revit’s Sheets/Views Sets in ACC Docs
body_text: Navigating Revit models in ACC Docs—especially 2D sheets—can be cumbersome. In Revit, we organize 2D sheets into sets (e.g., flooring, reflected ceilings, wall linings) using Publish Settings, but these sets are lost once they’re published to ACC . Instead, all 2D sheets appear jumbled together under the “2D” tab, making it difficult to locate what you need. Although the Design Collaboration module allows sharing/consuming sets to and from others, but having an organized 2D sheet sets structure

title: Model Coordination - Allow issue thumbnail to be updated
body_text: It makes no sense why this thumbnail can't be edited / updated like every other entry: The Autodesk recommended workaround ( https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/How-to-update-thumbnail-of-Issues-in-ACC.html ) isn't suitable because it removes anything useful (model elements from other models, element colouring) about the image coming from the clash space:

title: Default/Preset Filters for Submittals (and all other modules)
body_text: I would like the ability to enable default filters. 80% of the time, my subs and I would like to open submittals to go straight to shop drawings. I would like to have this filter enabled as default until I am ready to switch it off.

title: Ability to delete pojects - an Account Admin only function
body_text: This ability is needed as I have severla test and junk projects that should be delteted from BIM 360 and ACC completely. This function should only be accessible by Account Admins and any project (like in MS 365 licencing) have a 30 day period before the project is actually deleted so a project can be recovered before full deletion in case a project was accidently deleted.

title: Issue Reference Hyperlink Destination
body_text: Submitting this request on behalf of the EBA customer. Currently, when clicking "linked" Issues in Issue References, it directs to the issue within the list of Issues. The customer would like to have the link to be directing to the "Placement" of the issue.

title: Section box for point cloud viewer
body_text: Viewing point clouds in ACC Docs could benefit with having the ability to create a section box or clipping plane. For example, a point cloud of a building interior includes the ceiling, but to view the interior of the point cloud, its generally easier to have a clipping plane cut the point cloud below the ceiling to see the interior instead of trying to zoom and navigate to the interior of the point cloud. I was surprised to find a section box or clipping plane not available in the viewer, as I

title: Sheets - Compare/Overlay more than 2 drawings
body_text: You are limited to comparing two sheets at a time. It would be helpful to add a third, or more, to compare. Comparing plumbing, electrical, HVAC, etc. at the same time is very helpful. We have team members doing this functionality now in bluebeam and requesting to do it in ACC.

title: Platform // Add URL as an Attribute type
body_text: This is a pretty simple request. Allow an Attribute to be a value type of URL. Apply this everywhere, such as Files Column, Forms, Issues, etc. This is so we can reference linked data from other platforms. Furthermore, allow us to add a Link as a Reference.

title: Reference an issue to a markup
body_text: Would it be possible to refence a markup to an ACC Issue?

title: Download Files in App
body_text: On iPad/iPhone app, unable to download PDF files that are under the "Files" tab in Build. In order to do this we had to go onto a web browser on the iPad to be able to download the files. Would like to be able to do the same in the app itself. Thanks!

title: API to retrieve the Roles and IDs for an ACC Account/Hub
body_text: The information can be retrieved by posting a request to the Data Connector API, but our requirement is to retrieve the Roles and IDs directly from an API call.

title: Exporting ACC Issues Types/Templates for Use on Another Project
body_text: It looks like there's an option to transfer existing issues between Navisworks & ACC, but would it be possible to export issues either by type/category or template to be used/imported in another ACC project? I guess an alternate option would maybe be a separate tool for admin specific requests that need customizing & tracking in a similar way. A little more info: I'm testing a few custom admin request templates in our test project (ie. requesting someone be added to the project - see image). Onc

title: About the push pins on the drawing
body_text: The current situation is that the push pin used during the design review only indicates the position on the drawing. If the push pin could point to the actual component, the content of the comments would be reflected in the component itself, eliminating the need to explicitly describe the comments in detail and reducing the effort for the reviewer.

title: Custom Markups In Sheets
body_text: Looking for an option to upload/configure a library of custom markups that can be accessed via the markup tool bar within the Sheets tool. The need for field personnel to be able to drop additional devices on floor plans that can be seen by the personnel in the office (PMs/Engineers/etc) has been growing significantly. An additional feature to this request would be an option to upload our AutoCAD block library and/or Revit families for use directly in Sheets. I could also see this functionality

title: Saved SearchSets / Saved Searches in Navisworks Models (NWD) to be available in ACC Docs 3D Viewer Web
body_text: It would be very appreciated if we could have the possibility to retrieve the Saved SearchSets (Saved searches/ pre-configured searches feature) which are available in Navisworks Models (NWD) Navisworks Search Sets This allows to select in mass objects and perform operations like Hide / Show / Hide Unselected. In ACC Docs 3D viewer, we should have the possibility to access to the Searchsets / Saved Searches features: Thanks. Keywords: ACC Docs, 3DViewer, Navisworks, Model browser, Search, Saved

title: Submittal Markups - assigned color to reviewer step
body_text: Have the ability to assign a color to markups made by each reviewer step i.e. contrator - green, EOR - red, owner/client - blue.

title: File Search and Export + Improving Member Selection
body_text: When searching for files on the platform, it is essential that we have the option to export a master list and download files registered on a specific date. It is important that this filter is applied only to uploads (the most recent files in the system), excluding obsolete documents, those moved to another folder, or renamed files. This approach prevents confusion in distinguishing between new files and those that already exist. To ensure an efficient search, we suggest including a field for “ad

title: Batch Create Folder Substructure
body_text: I would like to have the functionality within the ACC (Docs) platform to batch create a project specific folder substructure. We currently have to create each folder one at a time for e.g. Architects, identifying project specific zones/buildings by folder, and then have to recreate each in Interior Design, etc. It would save all stakeholders a significant amount of time if there was a way to automate that either through a drag and drop feature, like Citrix Sharefile which recreates folders and s

title: Allow text formating in Build Forms.
body_text: It would be usefull to allow things like Bold, Underlined and changing the colour of text when answering questions in Forms or addig notes.

title: Provide two "Account Name" fields in Account Admin settings (Long form and Short form)
body_text: Please give us two fields for our "Account Name" under Account Admin settings (Long form and Short form). When reports are generated from Build, we prefer to use our long form company name which is 39 characters long. If we can use a short form account name for file pathing purposes, we can reduce this to 3 characters. We are currently running into major problems with mass project migration to ACC with long path errors that can be easily fixed with this path length reduction. I'm sure that this

title: Keyboard shortcuts note's ACC
body_text: For making notes or check models/sheets in ACC as a modeller myself I missed the Keyboard shortcuts to for example make arrows, texts, cirkels, pan, paint. For CAD mouses it would be nice to so you can use macro's to check/note on sheets.

title: Docs sorting by file type
body_text: I just realized that sorting by type in ACC Docs is not possible. Remedy that.

title: Meetings Items
body_text: There should be an option to search items by name. The option to filter the items is really basic.

title: Add roles to Default Coordinator and Reviewer in RFI Types
body_text: Adding roles to the Default Coordinator and Reviewer in Request for Information (RFI) Types can significantly improve the efficiency and clarity of the RFI process within a project. Right now, only individual members can be added as the default coordinator and reviewer.

title: Batch Editing of Document Attributes
body_text: It would be helpful if we can input data on multiple files in ACC. We created an attribute in ACC for our documents but we need to fill in the data on each document with the same value.

title: Custom PDF Reports
body_text: It is important to be able to use your own template for creating (Issue-) reports. In Germany, Issue Reports from the client to the contractor must contain certain components, such as a clear request to the contractor to correct the defect. For example, you could use a PDF with predefined form fields as a template, which would then be filled in automatically. Similar to the PDF forms in Autodesk Build.

title: Adding the option to close meeting items with the actual execution date
body_text: Today the situation is that if I created a meeting minutes today with some items with a due date set to 1 week, so I can close it only in the next meeting agenda. But if I finished the task earlier, I have no option of informing about it to anyone or even just logging the actual execution date. My suggestion is to add the option to define in the "Meeting items" screen the option to update the execution date without harming the original meeting's minutes. Then later on, when I make a "Follow-up"

title: Filter Sheets by Markups
body_text: It would be very helpful to filter sheets by weather or not they have any markups or not. I looked around but did not see a way to do this. This would help when sending comments back and forth between design teams and reviwers.

title: Activity Log _ Access Permissions
body_text: we need to be able to export a clear activity log to show us who add whom when , just a full activity log for all adimn.rights activities.

title: ACC Model Coordination - Issue visibility created from Navisworks Coordination plug-in
body_text: ACC Model Coordination module currently provides a great clash view of issues created when they are created directly from the ACC Model Coordination.
