However, if you create issues using the Coordination add-in in Navisworks, the view in Model Coordination now shows every model component vs. just the clash (red and green) and all other objects ghosted. It is hard to narrow in on the actual clash itself without a lot of manual work. It would be beneficial to have the same clash view whether the is

title: Issue Reopen status
body_text: It would be nice to have a status of reopened or have some data point that reflects this that you can use in Insight or as a filter. Think workflow of subcontractor marks an issue complete, the Project Manager verifies that the work was not done and changes it back to open. Being able to view those that were marked as complete but were validated that they were in fact not complete would be useful.

title: Select Only Specific Bidders in a Bidder List Template - Building Connected Pro
body_text: When adding bidders from one of your Bidder List Templates to a Bid Package inside a Project (+Add Bidders > Import tab), it would be helpful to make the list of Bid Packages expandable (located in the center of the window) after you've selected the desired Bidder List Template (on the left side of the window). That way, the user would have the option to select one, multiple or all bidders contained within each Bid Package of the Bidder List Template instead of having to add all bidders and then

title: Export Contracts as a Comprehensive PDF
body_text: Currently, under Cost Module, Autodesk Construction Cloud provides limited options for exporting contract information, and key commercial details are often spread across multiple views or reports. This makes it difficult to generate a complete, professional record of a contract for sharing, review, or archival purposes. It would be highly beneficial to have the ability to export contracts as a single, comprehensive PDF that includes all relevant information, such as contract line items, associat

title: Folder Permissions Matrix
body_text: Adding a function to a permission level should be a toggle instead of a drop down. Currently, if I want someone to upload files, they can then download files. But if I'm collecting items from multiple companies, I do not want to have them download other items. To solve cases like this: NAME VIEW DOWNLOAD MARKUP UPLOAD EDIT MANAGE Person Y N Y Y N N Company Y N N N N N Role Y Y Y Y Y N

title: RFI Creator Lockdown
body_text: Having a setting to allow RFI creators to not be able to add co-reviewers or mention people outside of their company or those already involved with the RFI would be a big value in firewalling and locking down access. Currently, if you mention someone, you can see the entire list of people on the project. If an owner is in there, we do not want just anyone to be able to tag them.

title: Add a Location Asset (similar to Systems) that auto pulls in all items that have that Location (or Room Number)
body_text: We have set up Rooms (or Locations) as Systems in Assets. Once this is done you can manually tie, Issues, Pictures, Files and other similar items to that Room (Location). This can create a good history of the room along with a quick view of outstanding or incomplete items. Once Assets are tied to the Room (Location) you can also see a list of all of them in the room and their individual status and if they have open Issues. This can also be a good way for tracking punch list item in a Room (Locat

title: Delete "empty field" feature or make this feature optional
body_text: What are the benefits of the new "empty field" feature? It results in more scrolling and obstructs other fields, as illustrated below: It's not possible to select a person, which is quite frustrating!

title: Allow for multiple responsible contractor submitters
body_text: Current submittal functionality only allows you to select one individual user as a responsible contractor, or a whole company. Many of our subcontractors have project managers and project coordinators that both upload items to submittals, so the inability to select multiple optional submitters creates issues when the other wants to submit items. Assigning to the whole company causes field personnel like foremen, or unrelated office staff to get unnecessary notifications. Some of our larger subco

title: Add Ability to Reference Forms Within Meetings Tool
body_text: There is currently no way to reference "Forms" from within the "Meetings" tool. This creates a gap in workflows where teams need to link inspection forms directly to pre-installation meetings for each trade partner. The system only allows one-way linking, but not both. Adding the ability to reference "Forms" when creating or editing meeting items would allow a fully connected, two-way workflow between "Meetings" and "Forms."

title: Account Admin - Members - Multiple Default Roles
body_text: At present, Account Admin only supports assigning a single default role to each member. This enhancement proposes enabling administrators to assign multiple default roles to a user at the account level, allowing for more flexible and accurate role configuration.

title: Tracking the activities / users
body_text: It’s not just for BY needs. Some consultants have subcontractors, and clients also have external consultants. For example, the client wants to see in ACC which documents these consultants have viewed or downloaded, which reviews they have completed, and the markups they have made. Currently, there is no easy way to do this.

title: ACC Viewer - DWG Labels/Text objects from Civil 3D are not visible in the ACC Viewer in 3D view
body_text: Problem: Labels and Text object are commonly used in Civil 3D to contain information. Users open DWG drawings to consult this information, sometimes from Civil 3d or sometimes from ACC. However, when opening DWG files in the ACC Viewer on a 3d view, the Labels and Text objects are not visible Desired outcome: EBA customer would like to make DWG Labels/Text objects from Civil 3D visible in the ACC Viewer in 3D view Current issue : Users cannot properly review DWG drawings in ACC since they cannot

title: Configurable Admin Permissions in Cost Management Module
body_text: The client owns the ACC account and wants to include both the main contractor and subcontractor in the project. However, the way the system is set up right now, anyone with project admin access has full control over all cost management data. This means the client’s team could potentially see all cost information, including details between the main contractor and subcontractor, which they want to avoid. Creating two separate projects to manage upstream and downstream costs isn’t a good solution,

title: Bridge - Need to keep cloud models as cloud models when we use bridge to transfer revit files
body_text: We have some projects with bridge because client has his hub and we need our hub. When we use bridge, it's "just" copy paste of the files, for Revit cloud models, it's a pain to create from scratch cloud models 1 by 1. Ok when it's just 2 models, when it's 10, 20, 50.... models, it's a nightmare!

title: Markups - Documents
body_text: Have a simple way and the databases to extract the markups with documents / reviews associated (data connector & insight builder).

title: Copy Paste document with markups
body_text: Have an option to keep the markups as markups when we copy documents (as in review workflow).

title: Reviews Interface Improvement
body_text: in the Reviews interface the data displayed for each file do not include the Title field. Most uploaded files on ACC use the title field for the document title and the Name for the document number. The description files that is available is not used. Please enable the Title filed to be displayed next to the document name in the Reviews interface

title: Add Ability to View and Search Projects by Project Address in the ACC Mobile App
body_text: Currently, projects in the ACC Mobile app can only be viewed and searched by project name. This creates challenges for users conducting assessments or remedial work across multiple project locations, where searching by project address would be far more practical. Additionally, display the project location on a map within the project home page, integrated with Google Maps to enable direct navigation.

title: Ability to remove references to closed Forms
body_text: It is currently impossible to remove a reference to a closed Form. This causes problems when the incorrect Form is accidentally referenced to an Issue/RFI/Submittal. In our company, references are used to help compile data packs that support work approvals, substantiate instructions to contractors, or are submitted to clients. The presence of incorrect references in these cases can lead to confusion and look unprofessional. This might be understandable if the reference to the Form was added befo

title: Takeoff - Hover Over & See Details
body_text: It would be great if when you hover over a takeoff, a little cloud pops up with the takeoff type details. Thank you!

title: Word Formatting in Autodesk Docs
body_text: Microsoft Word document formatting alters when viewed in “Edit” mode in Autodesk Docs compared to Microsoft Word itself.

title: Review - Progress Tracking Reviewers
body_text: Data we need to track, request done by BBI + client on project (not available in export review or data connector) We need to have in the data the key reviewers who did the review for each step with date (+ optional reviewers) & information for the markups (text and people who did it)

title: Extending Project Search to include project metadata such as Address
body_text: Hi There, Not too sure if this has been suggested before, but it would be beneficial to extend the front-end search capabilities of projects using project meta-data such as address and extending filtering options with project meta data as well. Thanks and much appreciated

title: Issues Placement
body_text: I am a Project Manager, and when I create an issue, I place it on a large overall drawing sheet in Collections (Sheets) so we can view all issues in one consolidated drawing. However, the General Foreman typically places issues on a shop drawing sheet, which is smaller in scale and contains more detailed information. I’d like the ability to place an existing issue (already created and located elsewhere) onto another drawing without having to create a new issue. This would allow us to view the sa

title: Issues done with a federated view in docs are not visible in Revit and Navisworks
body_text: The issues created in a view generated with Model coordination saved in docs are invisible in Revit and Navisworks.

title: Bring back Tasks capabilities from BIM 360 FIELD.
body_text: In BIM 360 FIELD under tasks yo can create actual calendar meetings and invite team members, Architects, Inspectors etc. It is a good visual to see what is happening for the day/ week and and it is nice to link the inspection/ checklist forms to those meetings. See attached.

title: Meeting Minutes - provide options for pdf export
body_text: I have started using the Meetings tool in Autodesk Build, and generally am enjoying using it. One element which would make communication easier, if when I download a pdf of the final set of minutes to distribute to other members, I would like to have some options about what information is included. Options to add: Include links to references and attachments? YES/NO Include 'Created On' information for each item? YES/NO Include 'Last Updated On' information for each item? YES/NO Include 'Meeting

title: Correspondence to be Included in Bridge
body_text: It would be helpful to be able to Bridge Correspondence between projects - currently if we want to share correspondence between projects it has to be saved as a .msg file to a Docs Folder, but the receiving project then need to download the file out of ACC to view the content.

title: Improve Sharing links functionality to link to files via ADC
body_text: Sharable links to files within the desktop connector. Currently you can only share weblinks to native design files. Develop functioanlity so links to the files within ADC can be generated. This should not require a common file folder defined as the desktop connector should be clever enough to understand the path whether its a user defined location for the cache or a common. This is an ACC issue that is not present in other CDE on the market. generating links is simple and usr freindly

title: Improved Search Functionality in Account Admin Apps
body_text: The ability to search for Apps at the Account Admin level is non-existent. The search should support keyword queries as well as filters by integrated product (particularly ACC Connect that has multiple connectors), category, and data region, similar to the Autodesk AECO Technology Partner Ecosystem. Autodesk AECO Technology Partner Ecosystem .

title: ACC Build - Forms
body_text: Hi, We would love to see more functionality added to Forms, our company’s implementation depends on it. Ability to skip or jump to specific questions based on previous answers (e.g. if you answer “Yes” to question 1, skip to question 5 — similar to LeanForms). Ability to save forms with assigned roles in the Forms library. Option to disable comments in form reports (clients can see these too). Checklists with simple yes/no checkboxes. Simplify the user experience in the ACC app (users currently

title: BuildingConnected Access to Multiple Companies
body_text: We’re encountering a workflow limitation in BuildingConnected where users are restricted to accessing only one company per email account. This constraint is especially challenging in environments where employees need to interact with multiple BuildingConnected spaces for proposal uploads and project collaboration. Because BuildingConnected is tied to Autodesk SSO, we’ve had to implement workarounds that introduce operational inefficiencies and potential security concerns. These include: Creating

title: Trade tapp questionnaire
body_text: I propose updating the TradeTapp questionnaire by introducing subsections within broader sections . This will allow general contractors (GCs) to more effectively organize related topics and streamline the review process by grouping questions into clearly defined categories. Additionally, I recommend implementing conditional logic and customizable question types . For example, if a subcontractor answers “Yes” to a specific question, the system should automatically prompt them to upload a required

title: Transmittal Indicator in Docs / Project Files
body_text: It would be helpful to be able to see which documents are in a Transmittal and if so, the transmittal number also. Whether this is just a indicator or more detailed to show in which transmittal(s) the file has been included would be a great feature addition.

title: Version History - Uploading missed or older files in sequence for record
body_text: Is there a way to add a document into the version history as record if it was missed when uploaded without it becoming the newest version. Example – All files are named FF&E Expediting Reports. V1 – uploaded 7/2 with a date in the doc as 7/2 V2 – uploaded 7/16 with a date in the docs as 7/16 V3 – Uploaded 8/2 with a date in the doc as 8/2 However, if an upload was missed say for 7/24. I am unable to add the file for record without messing with the version history. If I uploaded it, it would beco

title: Meeting Minutes - Agenda Items Date Reference
body_text: ACC meeting minutes has been a great way to track specific meetings with subcontractors each week. However, we have a rotating agenda for one such meeting. The problem we have faced is adding an item listed as Ongoing and it stays on the agenda for weeks. If we want to reference back that original item, there is no way to see when it was added without going through every meeting. It would be nice to have a way to have ACC show an edited note. Example: Item 4. Glass Handrails Glass Handrail Statu

title: Have change history for review workflows
body_text: On BIM360 it was possible to see in Activity when a review workflow has been changed, now on ACC that doesn't seem to show up at all anymore. Further to be able to see when a workflow has been changed, there needs to be detail on what has been changed, ie. role Doc Control added to step 1, member XYZ removed from step 1. This should be stored within the review workflow in Activity log and capture all saved changes.

title: Assets Systems - Filtering Tool
body_text: Asset Systems Filtering Tool so you can search what system you are looking for. Currently you have to go through each page to find the system.

title: Allow only Project Admins to Add or Change Sheet Asset Markups or Add a ‘Lock Asset Mappings’ Option
body_text: Please add a means to lock the Asset markup boundaries. Either create a ‘Lock Asset Mappings’ setting that Project Admins can set or, as with Location mapping markups, allow only Project Admins to add and update the Asset markup locations. Too often the people in the field are accidentally moving the Asset markup boundaries. These users require the ability to create and publish markups, so removing that Sheets permission from them is not an option.

title: Locations & Model Coordination - Add Room Number and Name
body_text: Unable to find an easy way to add Room Number and Name to Issues. Would like to see in the model space particularly what room the issue was created in.

title: Forms - Customizable Tables with Signatures
body_text: It would be good to have one section that has a table (similar to a smart form) where you can assign people/companies to sign to a particular row. At the moment you can only assign one company to one section.

title: Forms - QR Code
body_text: Similar to Assets have a QR code per form.

title: Watchers Data Connector Issues Data Schema
body_text: Currently, ACC Data Schema doesnt include "watchers" in the data extraction. Extracting this kind of metadata is necessary to build Issues-Custom Dashboard.

title: Add Sheets to Multiple Collections
body_text: Customers would like the ability to select multiple collections as they upload sheets. Customers often requires sheets to be located in multiple locations. This was automated in PlanGrid workspaces, but now requires them to do multiple uploads each time they get new drawing sets.

title: Enable direct integration of external data dictionaries into ACC Build
body_text: Enable direct integration of external data dictionaries into ACC Build It would be extremely valuable if ACC Build (and other ACC modules) offered an administrative interface where project administrators could connect external databases or company data dictionaries directly. These external datasets could then serve as controlled value lists for attributes in Assets, Issues, RFIs, and other objects . For example, an owner’s standardized classification codes or terminology could be enforced automa

title: Auto-generate forms for forms that are assigned to an asset category
body_text: In the Asset Category you can assign forms to it, which makes it easier to find and select them. I think it would be even better if these forms automatically were created once I assign the asset to an asset category. You still have the ability to create forms that correspond to multiple assets and if you change the asset category after it's been created then keep the forms already attached to the asset (don't delete them). Another method is to add an import functionality where we can list the fo

title: Permission Preview Matrix for Folders (Roles, Companies, Members)
body_text: Problem: In large, long-running projects (5+ years) with many externals and 200+ folders, it’s impractical to click into every folder to verify who has access. We need a one-shot overview showing which role, company, or person has which permission on which folder. Proposal: Add a Permission Preview Matrix view: Rows: Folders (with expand/collapse for subfolders) Columns: Roles, Companies, and/or Individual Users (toggle between views) Cells: Permission level badges (View, Upload, Edit, Manage) w

title: Display the number of files in a folder at the front of the folder
body_text: Displaying the number of files in a folder makes it easy to see which ones are empty and which ones you don't need to look at.

title: Add Insurance limits to displayed column data within TradeTapp
body_text: Adding Insurance limits data to the displayable column data within the TradeTapp main page. This would allow for filtering or organizing based on underlying insurance limits. As we currently only have access to expiration dates, adding insurance limits would provide a more complete picture. In conjunction with having Bidder List templates be available in TradeTapp, projects can have greater access and insight to important vendor data.

title: Color function for file folder icons in Files module
body_text: We would like to see a color-coding option in the files module for the folder icons. We are trying to status folders without using word "complete" or "done". For our closeout process, we have folders and sub folders, and it would be nice to just color code the folder when complete to get quick view of what still needs to be done. Rather than renaming the folder then when it's time to turnover the folders we are not going back and renaming again as we have to follow the folder structure folder na

title: Building Connected Notifications Hub
body_text: Is there any way that a common location or inbox can be added so that all previously received notifications and messages can be viewed at any time? Currently, when a User views a notification by clicking on the icon on the top right and mark it as "Read", there is no way to access that message again without going into the particular project to which the message was associated. If a User has many projects for which they are simultaneously responsible, it can be a cumbersome task to go through eac

title: Search Function for PDFs
body_text: You can ctrl + F in word documents living in Docs. But you cant ctrl + F for PDFs. It would be awesome to add this function to PDFs as documents are mostly shared with our team in this format.

title: Titleblock in project template
body_text: I want to make Titleblock templates in my project template.

title: Building Connected Bidding Response
body_text: We have noticed in our efforts to keep clean analytics and set up project templates, it would be very helpful if we knew the reason behind a contractor's "Not Bidding" Response. We would like to suggest adding a field for them to enter a reason for "Not Bidding".

title: ACC Docs, Build References option to Transmittals, Reviews, Meetings, Files
body_text: ACC is already having quite many tools that can use References (Issues, Forms, Assets, Files ...). The same functionality need to be added also to Transmittals, Reviews, Meetings. This way you can link information of tools within project and they can be easily found. Also files (f.e. pdf:s) need to have possibility to view in which tools the file is being referenced.

title: Revise Specification Groups after publishing
body_text: You need to be able to revise/assign specification groups after publishing - this should be under the "edit details" for either the spec section or group. If you make a mistake and don't assign a group during publishing (since it is not a required field), there is currently no simple way to move that spec section into a group, and your specifications view will be incorrect and disordered. You currently have to delete the entire version set and reupload/publish. I believe this is a standard featu

title: File Permissions Based on Custom Attribute Values
body_text: Currently, Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC) does not allow permission settings in Docs to be configured so that users can only access files with a specific custom attribute or column value. A typical scenario: A project folder contains hundreds of technical documents. It would be desirable for each discipline (e.g., electrical, HVAC, etc.) to only see the files relevant to them – based on an attribute like “Discipline = HVAC”. Suggested Feature: Ability to configure permissions in ACC Docs so t

title: Issues API - allow placement in viewables
body_text: Please add the possibility to place issues in specific coordinates in viewables (2D and 3D viewable files and sheets) for the POST Issues endpoint.

title: Submittal and RFI Reports - Option to embed referenced files with markups
body_text: When exporting a PDF Submittal Detail Report there is an option to embed attached files, but not referenced files. Manually inserting the referenced files to the exported report later is tedious and inefficient. The RFI tool allows referenced files to be embedded. Please can this functionality be provided in the Submittal tool as well? Furthermore, it would also be helpful if there was an option to include markups on the embedded references because there are often important markups made on files

title: Enable Users to Choose Whether Markups Carry Over on New Versions
body_text: It would be valuable to provide users with the option to decide whether markups carry over when a new document version is uploaded. For many, markups represent a point-in-time reference. Without this flexibility, some users continue to rely on traditional workflows, such as storing review documents in separate folders, instead of fully utilising the version control capabilities within Autodesk Docs. While search and filter tools for markups exist, they are not always intuitive. Requiring users t

title: Grid lines to be available within the 3d Models
body_text: Introducing grid lines within 3D models is crucial for improving spatial orientation and precision during modeling. This feature will assist users in accurately aligning and positioning elements within the 3D space, enhancing overall accuracy, and ensuring that the final model adheres to design specifications and standards.

title: Trail of Previous Due dates of meeting items in Meeting Minutes
body_text: In the Meetings tool of ACC Build, when meeting items are carried forward to follow-up meetings, their assigned due dates also carry over. However, if we update these due dates due to delays or changes in activity timelines, we are unable to view the history of previously assigned due dates within the current meeting minutes. To access this information, we must manually check each previous meeting’s minutes, which is time-consuming and inefficient. We request a feature that allows users to view

title: Cost Management - Ability to Add Budgets to Executed Contracts Without Admin Privileges
body_text: Currently, to add a new budget to an existing executed contract, the user needs admin privileges. It would be useful if regular users had this option, without having to give them admin privileges, which comes with additional risks and considerations. It would pair nicely with the recently added ability to reassign SCO budgets. With this change, the user could assign a new budget to an existing contract, then reassign the on-going SCO to the newly assigned budget. This access can be managed in th

title: Mass Photo Deletion in Autodesk Build
body_text: Can you please add a mass deletion option for photos in Autodesk Build.

title: Enable linking of existing model (RVT and IFC) across ACC folders
body_text: Current Limitation: When not using Cloud Models or using IFC models, ACC allows uploading host models alongside linked models (e.g., RVT, IFC), linking is rigid: it occurs only during the upload process and files remain fixed in their original folder. If models are already present in ACC, not just uploaded together, there’s no way to create or maintain links to them, especially when they span multiple folders or have been shared via Design Collaboration. Proposed Enhancement: Introduce functiona

title: Add a Company Logo to Stamp Templates
body_text: We would like to be able to add Company Logo onto the stamp in the Mark Up tool in Docs, this would be useful for projects where there are multi agencies collaborating on a project and documentation going through review processes.

title: Build - RFIs - Clearly indicate which company opened the RFI
body_text: It is not written anywhere which company is creator of RFI. We do not give manager role in RFIs to our subcontractors. They submit the draft RFI and TSL as manager creates RFI. We would like a new field where it is indicated which company is creator of RFI.

title: ACC Adding a member to 500+ projects
body_text: I am currently managing access for a new user within our Autodesk Construction Cloud environment. We need to grant this user access to over 500 projects, like existing team members. Manually adding the user to each project is not feasible and would be very time-consuming. I am seeking assistance or guidance on how to perform this operation efficiently. Specifically, I would like to know: Whether there is an existing feature or tool within ACC to bulk assign user to multiple projects. If API acce

title: Admins to be given Edit/Delete rights of Comments on Issues
body_text: CDE Administrators and BIM Coordinators, the custodians of Issues, would like the option to edit and remove comments. With anyone being able to comment but no one able to edit or delete them, it risks the comment section being full of errors, typos, contradicting information etc. and we as managers are not able to control the information. We want to encourage the use of the tool, but without any means of managing the information, we risk adding confusion, contradiction and complexity. I agree th

title: Summary dashboard of all open and closed items per company
body_text: We use company as responsible party for reviews, tech subs, issues and forms. We would like a report with graphics what is open, closed, overdue per company. We want to use company as ball in court in RFIs also, but you do not have this yet. Do yo think you can develop this report? It could part of insight module where we could have a dashboard per company. This would give us more control and save time. Currently we have to all of this manually and compile all open items by checking all reviews,

title: Request to Enable Correspondence Data Extraction for Reporting and Dashboarding – Autodesk Construction Cloud
body_text: We would like to raise limitation we are currently facing with the Correspondence Module in Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC) . The issue pertains to the inability to extract correspondence data , such as open vs. closed correspondences , either through the Reports or the Insight Dashboards . Current Challenge: The project team is actively using the Correspondence module to manage internal and external communication across multiple stakeholders (Contractor, PMC, Client, etc.). However, there is

title: Status Workflows in Forms (Auto-Close/Auto-Reject)
body_text: Use Case: Similar to the RFI or Submittals module, forms should have status workflows such as "Approved," "Rejected," "Returned," or "Closed." Additionally, forms could be auto-closed or auto-rejected after a defined time period if no action is taken. Importance: Currently, forms remain open indefinitely unless manually managed, which creates clutter and reduces system efficiency. Expected Benefit: Automated lifecycle management for forms, better data organization, and reduced manual workload fo

title: Submittals – Add option to include comments when exporting submittals
body_text: Certain tools in ACC Build including ISSUES and RFIs allow for comments to be included when exporting the item. When an ISSUE or RFI is exported, there is the option to include comments by means of a slider bar. It would be useful to have the option to include comments when exporting submittals. This would assist us as the comments made on submittals are important and should be documented for future reference.

title: Add Option to Attach Issue Attachments to Export
body_text: After Exporting an issue from Build you are unable to see the attachments that are connected to the issue without opening them in a separate tab. If you needed to send them to someone in one PDF file you would have to download everything and combine the PDFs. A solution for this would be to have to PDFs open at the bottom of the page in the same file.

title: Specifications Editing Page Sets
body_text: Add edit capability to Specifications, including the ability to edit what set a page belongs to. Currently there is no way to go back and add a new spec section for the commissioning documents or remove them from a section. Your only option is to delete the entire specification version and then reupload. You can’t delete pages and you can’t split up or add additional spec sections after publishing. So, if you make a mistake you must go through the whole painstaking process of sorting everything

title: File Format
body_text: Hello, It would be very helpful if ACC could accept HEIC picture format. Thank you

title: Copy Asset Locations and Mapping from Locations
body_text: Instead of having to outline the same areas on a Sheet, one by one of each asset, could the asset area be copied to be the same as the location area if the the Assets location is set to a location that has been mapped?

title: Improvement Request: Enhancing Visibility of "Inactive" Status in ACC Projects
body_text: We would like to address an issue with the current implementation of the "Inactive" status feature for ACC projects. The way the inactive status is currently displayed is misleading and causes confusion, as it is not clear that these projects cannot be edited. This lack of clarity often leads to unintended attempts to modify inactive projects. To resolve this, we propose making the "Inactive" status much more prominent with a bold notification that explicitly states the project cannot be edited.

title: Delete version
body_text: Need an option for a version to be deleted, not only superseded by another version

title: Add Toggle to Make "Location" Field Mandatory on ACC Forms
body_text: We propose adding a toggle option that allows form creators to make the Location field mandatory on ACC forms. This would give teams more control over form behaviour and improve data consistency. Background: The Location field is essential for organizing and categorizing form submissions, especially when managing a large number of forms across different departments or sites. Currently, users can submit forms without selecting a location, which often happens by mistake. This leads to untagged sub

title: ACC Build Specifications - Export, Collections and Handover
body_text: When reviewing the Build Specification feature there are a few ideas we would like to see considered for implementation to this feature. Please see listed items below. An option to export most current Specifications by filtering and export similar to Build Sheets. Add a way to include Collections feature in the Build Specification similar to Build Sheets. Project hubs will host multiple project phases and this will require more than one project specification set. Add Build Specification as a def

title: Suggestion for Improvement: Custom Project Working Days
body_text: We would like to suggest adding a simple option to customize project working days in Autodesk ACC. Currently, the default working days are set from Monday to Friday , but not all projects follow this schedule. Having the ability to define our own working days would greatly improve the accuracy of tracking submittals, reviews , and overall project timelines especially for teams operating on different workweek patterns . We believe this enhancement would provide more flexibility and better reflect

title: Markups done in Pdfxchange, Adobe Acrobat,  Bluebeam or other Tool should be visible in ACC Viewer
body_text: As the markup tool in ACC is way to inferior to many other pdf viewers, people are reluctant to move from Pdfxchange ato markup in ACC. There are tons of issues related to markups. So, it's very important to be able to view without any troubles the markups, postit and comments done using the desktop connector with other main pdf viewers. Right now many of those markups are not supported.

title: A Locked Files Manager for ALL Files in an ACC Project Using Desktop Connector
body_text: It would be useful if there were a screen where a Project Admin can view and manage all of the locked files in a project. It would be really helpful when renaming a project, managing what is currently in the desktop connector, or priming files for removal. Right now there's no central place to see what is in use on a project - only for individual users.

title: Co-reviewer in RFIs
body_text: When setting up an RFI workflow we often have an architecture firm who would like two people listed as Reviewers but they don't intend to have both review, its one or the other. When you include 2 individuals in the workflow, it doesn't advance until both parties respond or the RFI manager steps in and manually advances, answering on behalf of the non-respondent (I think). It would be great if there was a way to set it up where only 1 of the individuals included as Reviewers needed to review bef

title: Markup Packages or Groups
body_text: Combine the text, graphic (e.g. cloud) and attachment elements as a single markup on Sheet and File markups.

title: Sheet Collection Subfolders
body_text: Add subfolders in Sheets Collection folders.

title: Excel Exports
body_text: Would like any of the cost views / reports when exported into excel to retain their formulas instead of just being only their values.

title: Submittal Review Templates vs RFI Types
body_text: In the Submittal review templates, I can create specific workflows so that once a submittal is reviewed by one party, there is a separate reviewer that it goes to next. I can also select an entire company as the reviewer, so once someone from that company provides the review, it’s good to go. However, in RFI Types, I can only select a bunch of individuals to review rather than an entire company, and I can’t create a workflow to move from company to company or person to person, just a conglomerat

title: Sort Issues by Location and Created By
body_text: In the main Issues screen, can we sort the issues by location? Also, is it possible to sort by “created by”?

title: Autodesk Takeoff - Ability to Rejoin Exploded Linear Takeoff into a Single Polyline
body_text: In Autodesk Takeoff, once a closed or polyline linear takeoff is exploded, there’s no way to rejoin those individual line segments back into a continuous polyline. This is a major limitation for users coming from CAD workflows, where polylines can be edited and reconnected freely. We need a “Join” or “Recombine” feature that allows users to select multiple adjacent line segments and merge them back into a single closed or open polyline. This would: Improve editing flexibility Eliminate the need

title: Move the creation of companies and role to the recently added standards administrator role
body_text: I would consider company and role data to be Master Data for the ACC. Therefore the creation and maintenance of this data should be possible with the Standards Admin rights. Ideally there should be a general differentiation of technical and content responsibilities. This would allow a better secretion of duties between technical and content responsibilities, which typically is the case for customers with an own IT department. E.g. our Organization requires to limit privileged access to systems.

title: Project locations settings permission
body_text: In the project location settings, there's an option to add permissions. Please refer to the attached image where I've added one user but didn't work out. For him to see this location field, I need to make him as the Project Admin. Is there a way where we can provide him the permission as a member only? As we can't make all of them as the Project Admin.

title: Reviews - Attachment or References option
body_text: This module has so much potential but needs more flushed options to upload additional resources/references/documents to our review (at any given step). Ex. we want to use this for routing Change Order documents for review & approval (internally) before sending to contractor via Change Order Form. We can send the Change Order files for review but our procurement office needs to send us their Checklist as a part of their review which is not possible within the review workflow.

title: Autodesk Build RFI workflow
body_text: Hello, In most instances the current RFI workflow template works well. However, we have an instance where it would be nice to have some of the functionality of the Docs Approval Workflow. Some of the enhancements that would be nice are: - Reviewer type: Single, multiple - Options: Every key reviewer must review this step, A minimum number of key reviewers must review this step. Thank you!

title: Revision as related attribute but part of the file name in ACC
body_text: The problem we discovered when trying to use naming standard and revision value in our file names is that ACC doesn’t really work well with that. If we want to keep the revision in a file name and maintain versioning, we have to use a naming standard, BUT the revision must be a related attribute in this case. If it’s a related attribute, during the upload ACC won’t take revision value from the file name as the value of that attribute, so we have to write it in again every time we upload the file

title: Combine Companies or Members
body_text: Would like ability to combine duplicate companies or members and select which of the relevant information to keep on the remaining company.

title: Limiting Subcontractors from Viewing Project Photos
body_text: My team and I would like the capability to prohibit subcontractors from viewing project photos all together, as they should have no reason to view these within the Build module. We only want to give them access to the drawings/sheets, specifications, and the opportunity to submit RFIs and Submittals.

title: Building Connected - Add notes on specific contractors in Bidders List Templates
body_text: We would like the ability to add notes to a specific vendor/subcontractor in the Bidders List Templates. Important Information on main point of contact, project specialties, success on previous projects, etc... should be able to be added for future reference.

title: Managing the jobs of the Transfer-Tool
body_text: It would be a good feature for the usability of the transfer tool if set jobs could be edited and deleted. Currently, once they have been set, they cannot be changed

title: RESOLVED - Autodesk Construction Cloud - Reintroduce Business Unit Field in ACC Project Setup (Parity with BIM 360)
body_text: Details: In BIM 360, we had the ability to assign Business Units (BUs) to projects directly within the Account Admin interface. This allowed us to: Organize projects by division, region, or cost center Filter projects in dashboards or reports by business line Maintain internal alignment with our operational and estimating structures In Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC), this functionality has been removed or not yet implemented. Currently: There is no Business Unit field when creating or editing

title: Hourly Data Connector Extractions
body_text: It would be nice to be able to pull data from the data connector more often than once a day, preferably hourly. I am currently pulling the extracted data daily to a PowerBI dashboard, but the data changes multiple times throughout the day. Using the widgets on ACC would allow me to synchronously display our data, but the widgets are missing customizations, visualizations, and filtering options that our supervisors find useful.

title: ACC FORMS ACTIVITY LOG
body_text: It's better to capture the activity log forms not only changes in names also whatever action done capture as a activity log also can be export as pdf together with forms export. This activity log better capture the build in forms & Smart PDF forms.

title: Schedule | Import Tasks from Excel
body_text: It would be helpful if the export file from the taskplan could be edited in Excel, e.g. copying partial services and editing dates, locations etc. and then reimporting the file into the cycle plan. As an intermediate step, it would be useful if the table structures of the two Excel (esport, import) files matched so that the tasks could be copied line by line from the export file.

title: Project Template - Drawing Disciplines
body_text: We would like to be able to change and edit the default Disciplines, and Sheet types in our template, as this is currently an extra step we have to do when we start up a project.

title: Associate document templates to Contract type
body_text: To have the ability to associate document templates to a specific Contract type would be very helpful. Currently, purchase orders require different document templates than short form subcontracts, and long form contracts, etc. Each one might have some pages in common, but often the majority of the pages will differ between contract types. In the area to upload document types, to have the ability to associate a document type to a specific contract type would make less room for error in selecting

title: Custom attribute toggle in Cost
body_text: Custom attributes are a great way to get content into Document Templates that would otherwise have to be added manually, but when there are multiple document types for different contract types (PO/Longform/Shortform) and each might require different custom attributes, it makes it very confusing which attributes need to be filled out for which document type. To have the ability within custom attribute settings to specify a connection to a TYPE of contract, or to the document templates present wou

title: Build - Submittals - Filter per step
body_text: Please add filter per step in submittals. We already have this in Docs - reviews and it works quite well for us. We are used to on filtering per step to see what do we have to review, but currently we don't have this option in submittals. There is already indicator of step under ´Status´ field, but no filter.

title: Option to disable carry over of markup and issue to new file version
body_text: When markups/Issues are added to a file, they remain even after the file has been replaced with a newer version. This carry-over feature is not convenient when markups/Issues are used to indicate comments on the file. Typically, when a comment is added, it is expected that the file will be revised offline and re-uploaded with the same file name. Due to the current behavior, once the file is replaced with a newer version, the markups/Issues from the previous version may become misaligned on the n

title: Build - RFIs - ´Create RFI´ button in files, the same like issues
body_text: Can you please connect files and RFIs in the same way like issues are connected to all files? You could add one more button below issues. Currently we have to download all drawings, mark them on our laptop and then upload them to references. It would be so much more efficient if we could open RFI starting on the file it self.

title: Build - Meetings - Export meeting minutes in excel
body_text: Please add meeting minutes export in excel also, not only pdf.

title: Autodesk Takeoff - Enable move-from-point-to-point editing with snapping for takeoff objects
body_text: Currently, takeoff objects can only be dragged freely — there's no way to: Move from a specific base point Snap to another object or vector line Ensure precise alignment with other geometry This lack of precision makes cleanup and adjustments very difficult. Request: Add a move tool with “select base point” → “select target point” Include snapping to existing takeoffs or vector geometry Optional alignment tools (e.g., orthogonal or midpoint snaps) This would dramatically improve layout accuracy

title: Autodesk Takeoff - Add ability to toggle legend visibility over the sheet
body_text: Currently, the legend in Autodesk Takeoff is limited to the left panel and cannot be displayed over the sheet itself. In other tools, you can float the legend directly on top of the drawing, which improves field verification, coordination, and live QTO presentations. Request: Add a toggle to display the legend over the active sheet Allow repositioning the legend for flexibility Make it optionally visible when sharing/exporting sheets This would be especially useful for live takeoff sessions and

title: Option to add links to Autodesk Docs / Build Folders
body_text: Modern information-management practice is built around the idea of a Single Source of Truth. International standards such as ISO 9001 require every controlled document to carry a unique identifier and be maintained in only one authoritative location. When people need that document elsewhere—for example inside an individual project area—the accepted remedy is to surface it through a stable hyperlink, not a duplicate file. Microsoft’s SharePoint Online, for instance, lets you click Copy link; the

title: An additional Column for Discipline to facilitate management of Roles, review workflows for multi-discipline organisations
body_text: At present the system relies upon Company and Role. The role needs to include the specialisation, i.e. highway engineer. Under the current system this creates a a large number of repetitive project roles pre-fixed by the specialisation. Company--> Specialisation Role it would be easier to manage if an additional Discipline, i.e. Highways could be introduced. Company->Discipline->Role (simplified company roles list). This could be applied to the management of roles, review workflows and permissio

title: Log Files and/or automatic PDF-Export when closing a Meeting
body_text: Since changes to meetings are not currently tracked, there is a risk that project administrators could modify finalized meetings afterward. It is up to the participants to manually download a PDF copy of the minutes after each meeting to retain a secure record of the actual protocol. To improve transparency and data integrity in the Meetings module, it would be beneficial if: A PDF copy of the protocol is automatically exported and saved in Docs when a meeting is closed. All changes to meeting c

title: Improved visibility of assigned Form Templates to Asset by adding a placeholder for Form Templates into the Assets references
body_text: Form templates assigned to the Asset are visible in the references section of an Asset. This indicates that this Form Template is missing and should be filled for this Asset. The actual Form instance is only created after clicking on the placeholder entry.

title: Project List view management
body_text: My Home Project list is cumbersome to manage and contains projects that have been cancelled, completed, really old, awarded to other teams, etc... that I don't want to have to go through every time or have to request assist from a Project Admin who may not even remember the project. We should be able to either remove ourselves from an assigned project OR at a minimum, to customize our personal project display list to hide projects that we don't want to have to filter/scroll through → designate t

title: Locations across drawings
body_text: It would be helpful to be able to set a consistent location that will remain even when moving from drawing to drawing. Constantly needing to reset the location is tedious.

title: Custom Report Fields
body_text: I would like to create an RFI report that can include a custom field that I've added in the "Additional Information" section of the RFI page. When I go to create a report, I cannot choose this custom tag as a field that can be pulled into the report. It would be especially helpful if I can add in my own field sections to a report, and not have to add it manually every time I run the report.

title: Cost management Budget limitations
body_text: Currently there are uncountable limitations in the cost management module. If possible, I would like to break them down and hope from Autodesk Team to solve them as soon as possible as these are already hurting operations. Budget: 1- Budget limitation of 10,000 budgets per project. Most mega projects have at least 5000 Bill of quantities line items. Just imagine the number of budget line items associated to those. make the limit to be at least 50,000 budget line items. 2-Budget subitems. Current

title: Build - Meetings - Add role or company as assignee
body_text: We need you to add an option of adding a role or company as assignee. We have very fast projects with lot of staff turnover. We do not add project member almost anywhere, we always use roles and companies.

title: Exportable Issues Templates
body_text: Would be good to be able to do an export of the Issue Templates, where you could Copy templates, manipulate data and then re-import the template. Much like the Naming Tool functionality

title: Comments in reviews
body_text: Comments within reviews has raised a few issues for us: 1) The comments cannot be exported or viewed by anyone outside of the review 2) Reviewers instinctively review with comments when we insist on them using markups as the document needs to be printed for legal requirement. 3) The reviewer forgets to publish their markups. This is a disaster for the contractor when they print it out. It would be great to have the options to: 1) Turn off comments in a review flow. 2) Have enforced published mar

title: Permission to edit only the contents of a folder
body_text: It would be very interesting if there was an intermediate permission level between "Upload" and "Edit" where the user with this permission level could edit the documents contained in a folder, but not the folder itself. We created a standardized folder structure where the folder name should not be changed, but the documents contained in them should be editable. Using the Desktop Connector to access the documents makes this need even more urgent.

title: Transfer PlanGrid Projects to ACC
body_text: I would like to have the ability to transfer the sheets (at the very least) that we have in a PlanGrid project, to an ACC project. The sheet numbering and naming has already happen and aren't they technically the same on one platform and the other? I woul like to be able to just grab all the sheets WITH THEIR RESPECTIVE MARKUPS that we have created, and transfer that into an ACC project, so that we don't do everything from scratch.

title: Missing Markups Toolbar in 3D viewer
body_text: Adding Markups Toolbar within the 3D Viewer is my suggestion to improve clarity, traceability, and communication. It can be similar to the one available in 2D sheet views, allows users to add photos, highlight and markups directly on 3D elements, not just via the Assets feature.

title: Sorting document per name and naming convention
body_text: We use naming convection on all of our products, but in ACC Files everything get sorted alphabetically. For example we use BS for basement level, FN for foundation level, 00 for ground floor, 01 for first floor. In files everything get twisted and we lose logical order of drawings. See screenshot, basement is next to the roof and it needs to be on the top of this list. Is it possible to add option so users can pull the file in certain position in the list? We already have an option to in files,

title: Reviews - Settings of workflows - Setup review title
body_text: In settings of review workflows, please add an option for review title. Our subcontractors are submitting their drawings for reviews and they add unclear titles. We use naming convention COMPANY SCOPE-COMPANY NAME-SUBJECT OF REVIEW-LEVEL-REVISION in title of review. For example Precast PKB Office double walls, GF, rev C02 I would like to add automatic name as per workflow type. We create separate workflow for each subcontractor.

title: Greater permission settings for PCOs
body_text: Working from the Owner/Owners Rep perspective, the permissions for the PCO area are not as robust as required. There have been several situations where the Owner of the ACC hub will not be creating their own PCOs and will instead allow the Builder/GC, Architect, etc. access to the PCO tab, or even choose to allow the subcontractor to access. The only permission setting for PCO is Full Control or View all, which would allow each Role to see others PCOs and this is not desired in most situations.

title: Edit Invitation Email
body_text: Hello! Would it be possible to allow Account Admins within Build the ability to edit the email invitation that is sent when inviting members to a project? Instead of it stating: MemberName , ProjectAdminName added you as a member to Project. If you can't access the project, contact ProjectAdminName , the project administrator who invited you to this project. It would be nice to be able to change the name to either someone who is working on the project or something like: MemberName , CompanyName

title: Autotrigger approval workflow/review in the projecttemplate
body_text: In our current workflow we want to autotrigger an approval workflow/ or review process. This is possible in a project but not in the projecttemplate, which is anoying because I have to make the review every single time when adding a project.

title: Collections in Takeoff
body_text: I have a project that has two buildings. Each building has its own set of plans. When I go to add the sheets into takeoff, it requires me to create or add onto a version. Because it's multiple buildings, I need them to be separate. I was reviewing the help tab and I realized that on Build you have the functionality called "Collections." I recommend that the Collections feature be added to takeoff. This would greatly improve the functionality of the platform and relieve a lot of headache amongst

title: Upload Multiple Spec Books
body_text: On my current project, we have two separate spec books. Those two separate spec books share multiple CSI codes, so when we try to upload both spec books, they over-write one another. I know in my company there are several projects with multiple spec books who are running into the same issue. It would be extremely helpful to have a "Collections" tab or something similar to what the Sheets tool has that would allow us to upload multiple spec books without mixing them up.

title: RFI Notifications
body_text: I think it's odd that your RFI notifications matrix on the help files shows that the original Creator of an RFI does NOT get notified when the question is answered. They only get notified if the RFI was voided. It seems to me that of all the people to be notified when an RFI is closed, it should be the person who originally asked the question.

title: Autodesk Takeoff - Allow Manual Sorting or Reordering of Takeoff Types
body_text: Right now, takeoff types in Autodesk Takeoff are automatically sorted alphabetically in the left panel—and that’s it. This makes it difficult to structure takeoffs in a logical or construction-sequenced order unless we manually rename each item with numbered prefixes (e.g., "01 - Footings", "02 - Slab", etc.). That’s a clunky workaround and shouldn’t be necessary. Please allow: Manual drag-and-drop reordering of takeoff types Optional sorting by creation order or custom sequence Pinning of commo

title: Issues Pin Placement
body_text: Hello team Our proposal is Issues pins to embed within the file and not stay in particular place/page where they have been raised. Embedding helps to track the issues in previous version(V1) and current version(V2), rather then pins staying in same place. This is causing our team to go back to pervious version(V1), and find where the actual issue is in current version(V2). For example: If issue is raised in page 2 line 10 of the file. When we have new version uploaded with more pages or amended

title: Add a "Dark Mode" option or toggle in the dropdown settings menu
body_text: Adding a dark mode to the Autodesk Construction Cloud interface would be a valuable improvement for many users who spend extended periods working within the platform. Construction professionals often use the software in a variety of lighting conditions — such as dimly lit offices, jobsite trailers, or during late-night planning — where a bright interface can lead to eye strain and fatigue. Dark mode has become a standard feature in many modern applications for good reason. It reduces visual fati

title: Enable users to customize and assign their own colors for takeoff elements, either per classification, scope, or manual selection. This added flexibility would improve visual clarity, reduce confusion
body_text: Currently, Autodesk Takeoff assigns predefined colors to elements during takeoff, which helps users visually distinguish between different items in the drawing. However, the available color options are limited. This becomes a challenge when working on complex drawings with numerous categories or trade disciplines, as colors start repeating or become difficult to differentiate.

title: Forms
body_text: If a photo is taken within a form that has a location identified, it would be tremendously helpful for the location tag of the form to tranfer over to the photo...

title: Forms template builder: additional custom fields
body_text: Hello, I would like to suggest a new feature to the form template builder: Custom fields to the form template builder. The location field can be linked to the project's locations. For example, in public works projects, we are required to record the subcontractor's timesheet (start time, end time, etc.) so that it can be compared to their certified payroll, ensuring they are complying with prevailing wages. It is important to match their records with ours before they get paid. The GC's admin staf

title: RFI Close date to be included in Report
body_text: When running an RFI log, it would be really helpful for the report to include the close date.

title: Form automatically saved in ACC Docs specified folder
body_text: Forms should be automatically saved in a specified folder once it has been finished/closed. In the forms templates the user should have the option to set a folder for this functionality. Currently the user has to manually export a report of the Form to save it in a specified folder. This is one step too much.

title: Markups: change display order
body_text: The option to change the display order of markups is missing. Especially when copying markups with backgrounds, the display order is not the same as the original. Therefor you have to recreate the elements with background.

title: Build - All Columns Sortable
body_text: Need to be able to sort all of the tools by any column, including custom fields. An example: In Issues you can not sort the Assigned To Column to group Issues by assignment.

title: Filling out fillable PDFs via Files
body_text: Could you make it possible to fill out fillable PDFs under Files in Autodesk Build, rather than just under Forms?

title: disallow special characters for cloud project name
body_text: I've encountered at least twice now a situation where an ACC/BIM360 project name contained an illegal character such as: <>:"/\|?*' This causes issues when trying to link files in Revit becuase the folder name, which is identical to the project name, is illegal, cauing it to be impossible to navigate to the project folder containing the files. Obviously, the project name should not be allowed to have such characters, same as how ACC does not allow these characters for any folders- see screenshot

title: Create a list of markups automatically
body_text: Build should provide a utility to create a list of markups automatically. I love the markup feature, but when reviewing large drawing sets, it is very helpful to provide a list of all the markups as feedback to our A/E's for use a a checklist. Adobe has this feature built in, but the PDF engine of Build does not add markups as a native PDF "comment". I grew tired of this lack of functionality so yesterday I used Grok AI to create a python script to do it for me. export the files with all markups

title: Assign users to existing projects
body_text: Give me the option of assigning new users to all existing projects. when we hire a new employee, I add them to our template so they are added to all new projects. However, every time they need access to an existing project i need to go to the project and add them in manually. Creating groups and giving a group access would be a tremendous improvement. Then if I added them to our new user to the group they would have access to any project that group had access to

title: Direct Document attaching or linking in Assets in the ACC App
body_text: Just as it is already possible with "Issues," it would be very helpful to directly add documents to the selected "Asset." Especially on the construction site with the ACC App on a tablet, it often happens that documents from other apps need to be added (e.g., protocols). Currently, this must be done very awkwardly by first uploading the file under "Files," then returning to the assets to select and link the file. Alternatively, it would also be possible to allow direct file uploads when adding f

title: Add Access Level Filter to Members Filters
body_text: It would be helpful to add a filter by (Access Level) in the Members tab (under Project Admin or Docs), similar to the existing filters for Company, Role, Product Access, and Status. In large-scale projects, there may be multiple Project Admins, and as an Account Admin, the ability to quickly filter for only those Project Admins would streamline reviews, checks, and change their access to project member.

title: Photos in Daily Report Work Log
body_text: We need the ability to add photos directly in the Work Log section of the Daily Report Form. We like taking photos of the work we are logging, and they should be directly in the Work Log for easy reference, and display that way on the PDF of the form report PDF.

title: Business Units in ACC
body_text: As in BIM360, it would be good if we could also define and specify business areas in ACC.

title: Visual settings
body_text: It would be beneficial to have a "dark mode" to prevent migraines from occurring when working extensively on ACC. This would also help with blue light being produced from the screens and reduce the energy consumption of machines when ACC is being used. Even a simple Color inversion, like the two images attached, would be massively beneficial.

title: ACC Bridge
body_text: Can not bridge across different Autodesk datacentres - why? Don't hide behind the GDPR and other sob stories about different regions having different data rules and laws.

title: Notifications for Roles
body_text: When a member is assigned a role in a project currently they do not get email notifications or added to their home page that they are added to an issue, review, or submittal. We have our project templates to go off of roles rather than a specific member incase that member is pulled off the project or another member is added to that role to help in completing a task. There is less managing of updating to a new member if that comes up and multiple people can be assigned to an item to have a notifi

title: Viewing Appended Point Cloud Models in ACC Model Viewer
body_text: There are project teams often works with point cloud files in Navisworks, and we think it would be useful if appended point clouds were viewable directly within the model viewer on Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC). This feature could simplify collaboration and allow everyone involved to access detailed data in real-time without needing additional software. If point clouds were integrated, it could streamline workflows and make ACC an even more powerful tool for project coordination. Just a thou

title: Mobile App Project Address
body_text: The project address does not appear on the mobile app. While we don't need it on the home page, having project about information would be nice either in the menu button or it's own tool/module. This will be incredibly helpful for field workers who need to go to different project sites, a new project site, etc. Same for inspections, etc.

title: Takeoff - Multiple Published 3D Views
body_text: The request is to have the option to choose from any of all 3D views that were published in Revit. There is a common workflow where we have multiple Takeoff packages for different systems that correspond to different 3D views in Revit. Not being able to use the same Revit model for these different packages is limiting. The workaround we have to do is export an IFC file of each 3D view we want to pair with a package, but this is very time consuming.

title: Model Coordination // Move the Levels to the Model Browser panel // Undock the Model Browser
body_text: Two years ago, I proposed moving the Levels toolbar button and floating panel to the Model Browser panel. This seemed like a simple and logical request to help with navigational efficiency. Today, and as per the September 2024 Product Release notes, this has been moved to a dedicated tab and panel on the left side. This is an objectively terrible decision. With the Levels now as its own docked panel, levels cannot be visible/accessible at the same time as the Model Browser panel. The user now mu

title: Updating review workflows - Current Submittals
body_text: As project teams change, the person(s) responsible for reviewing submittals changes. When updating the review workflow it will only apply itself to submittals created after the workflow had been updated. There should be an option to update the workflow of every open submittal so that each one does not have to be manually updated.

title: See Photos in Build in list
body_text: It should be possible to change the grid to list display in the Build Photo section. Also the possibility of deleting them in batches and not one by one, and detecting duplicate photos before uploading them.

title: Auto-trigger Review on incoming bridge
body_text: Auto-trigger review is not working if files are placed by 'ACC-system', because you can't select this 'user' while creating a review. It would be wonderful if you can edit your Auto-trigger Review settings with a checkbox 'folder is bridged' or something, so it overwrites the initiator mentioned in the initial Review by 'ACC-system'.

title: Bridged team references are tough to tell apart
body_text: When projects are Bridged in ACC they commonly have the exact same or very similar team names. ACC/Bridge only shows a generic number in parenthesis to tell these apart. If several Bridges are made to the same project it is not good enough only to get extra information about what project they belong to by hovering or clicking the (i) information icon. Users should be able to tell the team origins at a glance. I don't have a perfect suggestion about what would be the best way to do this, but mayb

title: Reviews - Provide ability to add files/items at each stage in a workflow.
body_text: We need the ability to add or change the files at each stage in in the workflow not just at the Initiator stage. The current process seems to assume the same items will be used throughout the workflow. However, it is often necessary to add additional items or files or even change the original files to new ones at each stage. Consider a QA/QC process where the initial items are submitted to the QA reviewers who mark them up and may need to add additional items/files and then send them back to the

title: Replace existing family parameter with parameter service shared parameter
body_text: When edited, an existing family parameter can not be converted to a shared parameter originating from the parameter service. We need to be able to select a parameter service shared parameter while in the edit window. Existing Revit families, or those from manufacturers that are being prepared to work with our template, frequently need family parameters converted to shared for the purpose of tagging or schedules. This has traditionally been done by editing the existing parameter (which may be att

title: Add the Issues tool to the Takeoff module
body_text: Currently, users have the ability to pin issues to documents in Docs (or model in Model Coordination, or sheets in Build), but there is no visibility to the Issues tool. It would be beneficial to have the ability to view the Issues list in the Takeoff tool. Low-level desire is the ability to view/pin issues to documents in the Files tool of the Takeoff module. The end-state desire is the ability to pin/view issues in the Sheets & Models tool of the Takeoff module (with the pins also going back t

title: Regarding the notification settings for comments
body_text: Currently, when a notification for a review comment is made individually, it is immediately or at regular intervals received by the person who was notified. However, if multiple comments are sent at once, they are only received by the notified person at regular intervals. Even when multiple comments are sent at once, I would like the notified person to receive immediate notifications.

title: RFI Question & Suggestion text formatting and Return
body_text: Have the ability for format text in the question, suggestion, response boxes of RFIs. At minimum one should be able to return and bulletize (even if it's just with hyphens) items within the question, suggestion, response.

title: Meeting Items without Status
body_text: It would be nice to be able to take note of something without having to set the Item to Open/Closed. Some things are just informative that are necessary to record for history but are not necessarily actionable. Adding these Items is necessary within specific Topics, so it is not appropriate to just throw all of these items in the "Meeting summary" area because they won't be organized very well. Example Items within a Topic: Joe discussed clearance zone requirements for clash detection. Electrica

title: Include Specifications in the Template Definition
body_text: Include Specifications in the Template Definition

title: Visualizar archivos .E57, las y .lgs
body_text: Viewing .E57, las and .lgs files is very important to load the information from the 3D Scanner and Lidar for better coordination of projects. In addition to loading and viewing the point cloud files in ACC, it is very important to be able to link with the 3D models. Currently you can load and view .RCP files but it is very important to have more alternatives in file format. Visualizar archivos .E57, las y .lgs es muy importante para cargar la información del Scanner 3D y Lidar para una mejor coo

title: ACC Folders Permissions
body_text: When we create the teams on ACC for Design collaboration the folder permissions change. We need to remain the permissions when the teams are created to get them from template instead of changing for each folder of different projects.

title: Model Coordination 'Save to Docs' // Add an out-of-date models indicator
body_text: In the Model Coordination Views, we can see the last time the view was 'Saved to Docs' and we can see the last time the View was updated (not its models). But we are missing an indicator that tells us if the models within the view are newer than what was last Saved to Docs. The only way to know is to change to the Models tab to check the update dates, and then come back to the Views. It would be nice if this was simplified to show an 'out-of-date' indicator for each View.

title: Duplicate Form Template
body_text: It's really handy to have a feature in Autodesk Build that allows you to duplicate a form template. This way, you can easily create a similar form and just make minor adjustments. It's a great time-saver!

title: More Background Colour Options (Model Space, Layouts, PDFs)
body_text: The white/black background toggle in the ACC viewer looks to be a global setting however we don't typically view everything that way. Ideally we would have extra toggle options so we can control it differently in various situations. For example, I would set mine to the following: 1) 2D model space to be black 2) Layout space to be white 3) PDF sheets to be white (the pdf's are white thumbnails but change to black when you open it if you have it set to a black background)

title: Option to get rid of subcontractors in Submittals Workflow.
body_text: It would be great to have the option to not "assign to responsible contractor" For our current workflows, only the General Contractor send submittals on behalf of their subcontractors. Basically the GC needs to assign the submittal to themselves, then send it to the Consultant. Its a redundant step. Have the option to "toggle off" the "responsible contractor" section in submittals would be great!

title: Only Account Administrators should be able to assign Project Administrator Access Level
body_text: In general, we need much better permission controls at an account level. Most importantly, we need to prevent members from outside of our organization being accidentally given project administrator rights. Currently, project administrators can just make anyone invited to the project a project administrator as well. We should be able to control, at an account level, who can be given project administrator rights. It would be great to further this control down to specific permissions to folders in

title: Batch Create Project Data
body_text: There are multiple places in ACC where you need to enter long lists of data one item at a time. This is extremely time consuming and error prone. There should be a way to import lists like that from a spreadsheet or csv file. Areas where this would be a huge help include: Build - Sheets - Settings - Disciplines (This one in particular should be in the project template!) Build - Submittals - Packages - Create Package Build - Submittals - Spec sections- Create spec section

title: Move files after Approval
body_text: It would be helpful for some workflows to have an option of moving files after approval in Reviews in Autodesk Docs.

title: Allow Mark-Ups in Files Using Mobile Web Browser
body_text: In the review process or approval workflow of Autodesk Docs, every time the reviewer receives an email using mobile device about an action item, clicking the button leads to the mobile web browser. The problem is that the reviewer couldn't provide markups in the file. The markup tools show up. However, they couldn't be placed on the pdf. Tapping anywhere just selects the whole page. Also, when doing hold and drag, it just pans the page. This issue occurs both on Android and iOS. Additionally, th

title: Organize Views List within Views tab
body_text: Currently in the Model Coordination module within the Views tab, the list of Views that appear are in order of when they were created. It would be beneficial to be able to organize this Views list based on personal preference. That way you are able to keep all Views associated with a building close to each other or have them in alphabetical order or order of install, etc. Right now the only way to put them in a preferred order is to create them in that order, but if the order were to change at a

title: Specifications Module Improvements
body_text: The count (1 of 22) on the bottom of the table represents the number of spec sections instead of the number of specifications. I would expect the count to represent the number of specifications I have uploaded in total, making it easier for me to audit against my GC's portal. Can this be changed?
